trauma.eng_def: (a) severe emotional shock and pain caused by an extremely upsetting experience
(a) severe injury, usually caused by a violent attack or an accident
trauma.chi_def: （通常由猛烈攻擊或事故造成的）嚴重外傷，損傷

travel.eng_def: to make a journey, usually over a long distance
travel.eg: Between school and university, she spent a year travelling, mostly in Africa and Asia.

travel.eng_def: to move or go from one place to another
travel.eg: Supersonic planes can travel faster than the speed of sound.

travel.eng_def: If something such as food travels well/badly, it does/does not stay in good condition if it is moved long distances.
to make a journey without taking a lot of heavy things with you
travel.eg: I always try to travel light.
a record of her travels in/around the Far East

tray.eng_def: a flat object, usually with raised edges, used for carrying food and drinks
tray.eg: She was carrying a tray of drinks.

tray.eng_def: a flat, open container with raised edges that you put on your desk for keeping papers in
tray.eg: She put the letter in your intray.

tread.eng_def: to put your foot on something or to press something down with your foot
tread.eg: I kept treading on his toes when we were dancing.
He trod heavily and reluctantly up the stairs.

tread.eng_def: to float vertically in the water by moving the legs and the arms up and down
the pattern of raised lines on a tyre that prevents a vehicle from sliding on the road
tread.eg: The tread on your tyres is very worn.

tread.eng_def: the sound that your feet make on the ground as you walk
tread.eg: Then I heard someone's tread on the stairs.

tread.eng_def: the horizontal part of a step on which you put your foot

treason.eng_def: (the crime of) showing no loyalty to your country, especially by helping its enemies or trying to defeat its government
treason.eg: In 1606 Guy Fawkes was executed for treason.

treasure.eng_def: very valuable things, usually in the form of a store of precious metals, precious stones, or money
treasure.eg: Stories about pirates often include a search for buried treasure.

treasure.eng_def: very valuable things, especially pieces of art
someone who is very helpful and valuable to you
treasure.chi_def: 很有用的人；很重要的人
treasure.eg: I don't know what I'd have done without Lizzie when I was ill - she was an absolute treasure.

treasure.eng_def: a friendly way of talking to someone, especially a child
treasure.chi_def: 寶貝（親昵稱呼，尤指小孩）
treasure.eg: Come on, treasure, let's go and see Granny.

treasure.eng_def: to take great care of something because you love it or consider it very valuable
treasure.eg: I will always treasure those memories of my dad.

treasury.eng_def: the government department, in the UK and some other countries, that is responsible for financial matters such as spending and tax
treasury.chi_def: （英國及其他許多國家的）財政部

treat.eng_def: to behave towards someone or deal with something in a particular way
treat.eg: My parents treated us all the same when we were kids.

treat.eng_def: to use drugs, exercises, etc. to cure a person of a disease or heal an injury
treat.eg: He is being treated for a rare skin disease.

treat.eng_def: to buy or pay for something for another person
treat.eg: Put your money away - I'm going to treat you (to this).

treat.eng_def: to put a special substance on material such as wood, cloth, metal, etc. or put it through a special process, in order to protect it from damage or decay
treat.eg: The material has been treated with resin to make it waterproof.

treat.eng_def: a special and enjoyable occasion or experience
treat.eg: We're going to Italy for the weekend - it's my birthday treat.

treat.eng_def: an occasion when I, you, etc. buy or pay for something for another person
treat.eg: No, you paid for dinner last time - this is my treat.

treatment.eng_def: the way you deal with or behave towards someone or something
treatment.eg: Peter gets special treatment because he knows the boss.

treatment.eng_def: the way something is considered and examined
treatment.eg: The same subject matter gets a very different treatment by Chris Wilson in his latest novel.

treatment.eng_def: the use of drugs, exercises, etc. to cure a person of an illness or injury

treaty.eng_def: a written agreement between two or more countries, formally approved and signed by their leaders

tree.eng_def: a tall plant that has a wooden trunk and branches that grow from its upper part
another type of tall plant, without a wooden trunk

trek.eng_def: to walk a long distance, usually over land such as hills, mountains, or forests
trek.eg: We spent the day trekking through forests and over mountains.

trek.eng_def: a long walk over land such as hills, mountains, or forests
trek.eg: We did an eight-hour trek yesterday.

trek.eng_def: a walk that is long and difficult or makes you feel very tired
trek.eg: You can walk to town from here, but it's quite a trek.

tremble.eng_def: to shake slightly, usually because you are cold, frightened, or very emotional
tremble.chi_def: （通常因寒冷、害怕或情緒激動）顫抖，發抖
tremble.eg: When he came out of the water, he was trembling with cold.
There was a slight tremble in her voice as she recalled her husband.

tremendous.eng_def: very great in amount or level, or extremely good
tremendous.eg: They were making a tremendous amount of noise last night.

tremor.eng_def: a slight shaking movement in a person's body, especially because of nervousness or excitement
tremor.chi_def: （尤指因緊張或興奮）顫抖，發抖
tremor.eg: The disease mostly affects people over 50, causing paralysis and uncontrollable tremors.
The tremor was felt as far as 200 miles away.

trench.eng_def: a narrow hole that is dug into the ground
trench.eg: A workman was killed when the sides of the trench he was working in collapsed.

trench.eng_def: a deep hole dug by soldiers and used as a place from which they can attack the enemy while being hidden
trench.eg: the trenches of the First World War

trend.eng_def: a general development or change in a situation or in the way that people are behaving
trend.eg: Surveys show a trend away from home-ownership and toward rented accommodation.

trend.eng_def: a new development in clothing, make-up, etc.
trend.eg: Whatever the latest fashion trend, you can be sure Nicki will be wearing it.
Her long skirt is right on trend this winter.

trend.eng_def: to be one of the words, subjects, or names that is being mentioned most often on a social media website or a news website at a particular time
trend.chi_def: （某一時刻在社群媒體或網站上）被提及最多的詞語（主題或名字）
trend.eg: Within minutes of the incident her name was trending on Twitter.

trespass.eng_def: to go onto someone's land or enter their building without permission
trespass.chi_def: 擅自進入，侵入（他人土地或建築物）
trespass.eg: I hope this is a public footpath and we're not trespassing on someone's land.

trespass.eng_def: to do something or act in a way that is not morally acceptable
the crime of going onto someone's land or entering someone's building without permission
trespass.chi_def: 擅自進入，侵入（他人土地或建築物）

trespass.eng_def: an offence in which you break a moral or religious law
trespass.chi_def: （違反道德或宗教律法的）罪過

trial.eng_def: the hearing of statements and showing of objects, etc. in a law court to judge if a person is guilty of a crime or to decide a case or a legal matter
a test, usually over a limited period of time, to discover how effective or suitable something or someone is
trial.eg: They're doing clinical trials on a new drug.

trial.eng_def: a person or thing that is annoying and causes a lot of problems
trial.chi_def: 惹麻煩的人；令人傷腦筋的事物；考驗
trial.eg: She was a real trial to her parents when she was younger.

trial.eng_def: an exam taken at school for practice before a real exam
to test something in a formal way to discover how effective or suitable it is
trial.eg: We will trial the new drug in several hospitals.

triangle.eng_def: a flat shape with three straight sides
anything that has three straight sides
triangle.eg: Which earrings did you buy in the end - the triangles or the circles?

triangle.eng_def: a musical instrument consisting of a thin metal bar bent into a triangle shape that is hit with a metal bar to make a sound
a flat piece of metal or plastic in the shape of a triangle with one angle of 90°, used for drawing angles
a three-sided frame for arranging the balls at the start of a game of billiards, pool, etc.
triangle.chi_def: （在檯球等比賽開始時擺放球用的）三角板

tribe.eng_def: a group of people, often of related families, who live together, sharing the same language, culture, and history, especially those who do not live in towns or cities
a large family or other group that someone belongs to
tribe.eg: We invited Carol's sisters and brothers and their families - the whole Cassidy tribe.

tribute.eng_def: something that you say, write, or give that shows your respect and admiration for someone, especially on a formal occasion
tribute.chi_def: （尤指在正式場合表達敬意的）頌詞，禮物
tribute.eg: Tributes have been pouring in from all over the world for the famous actor who died yesterday.
The minister paid tribute to the men who had fought the blaze.

tribute.eng_def: to show clearly how good, strong, or effective something or someone is
tribute.chi_def: 是（優秀、強大或有效性）的明證
tribute.eg: I've never met a five-year-old as well behaved as your son - he's a tribute to you!

trick.eng_def: an action that is intended to deceive, either as a way of cheating someone, or as a joke or form of entertainment
trick.eg: She played a really nasty trick on me - she put syrup in my shampoo bottle!

trick.eng_def: to be an effect caused by light, making something appear different
trick.eg: For a moment I thought you had a patch of grey hair, but it's just a trick of the light.

trick.eng_def: what children say when they go  trick-or-treating  at Halloween
trick.chi_def: 「不款待就搗蛋」（孩子們在萬聖節玩這個遊戲時所說的話）

trick.eng_def: an effective or quick way of doing something
trick.eg: What's the trick to getting this chair to fold up?

trick.eng_def: to deceive someone, often as a part of a plan
trick.eg: Dean tricked the old lady into giving him eight hundred dollars.

trick.eng_def: used to deceive someone, either as a joke or form of entertainment or so that they makes a mistake
trick.chi_def: 捉弄的，戲弄的；惡作劇的

trick.eng_def: A trick part of the body, especially a joint (= place where two bones are connected), sometimes feels weak suddenly and unexpectedly.
trick.eg: I have a trick ankle that gives me problems if I run too much.

tricky.eng_def: If a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill.
tricky.eg: It's tricky to learn to ride a skateboard, but you never forget how.

tricky.chi_def: 欺騙性的；狡猾的；詭計多端的

trifle.eng_def: a sweet cold dish consisting of a layer of fruit and cake, a layer of custard (= thick, sweet, yellow sauce) and a top layer of cream
trifle.chi_def: 鮮奶油鬆糕，果醬鬆糕（一種甜點，包括一層水果海綿蛋糕、一層蛋奶醬和一層鮮奶油）

trifle.eng_def: a matter or object of little value or importance
trifle.eg: I brought a few trifles back from India - pieces of jewellery and fabric mainly.
I'm a trifle confused about the arrangements for tonight.

trigger.eng_def: a part of a gun that causes the gun to fire when pressed
trigger.eg: It's not clear who actually pulled the trigger.

trigger.eng_def: an event or situation, etc. that causes something to start
trigger.chi_def: （引起某種壞事的）一件事（或情況）
trigger.eg: There are fears that the incident may be a trigger for more violence in the capital.
Some people find that certain foods trigger their headaches.

trim.eng_def: to make something tidier or more level by cutting a small amount off it
to reduce the amount or size of something
trim.eg: They're trying to trim their costs, so staff who leave are not being replaced.

trim.eng_def: thin in an attractive and healthy way
trim.eg: You're looking very trim - have you lost weight?
trim lawns and neat flower beds

trim.eng_def: an act of making something, especially someone's hair, tidier or more level by cutting a small amount off it
trim.eg: I asked the hairdresser for a trim.

trim.eng_def: physically prepared and ready, or in good condition
trim.eg: Are you in trim for the run on Sunday?

trip.eng_def: a journey in which you go somewhere, usually for a short time, and come back again
trip.eg: The trip from York to Newcastle takes about an hour by train.

trip.eng_def: an occasion when you knock your foot against something and fall or lose your balance, or someone causes you to do this, when you are walking or running
trip.eg: She broke her ankle when she had a nasty trip on the stairs.

trip.eng_def: an experience in which someone sees, hears, or feels things that do not exist as a result of taking an illegal drug
trip.eg: If you take this stuff when you're depressed, you'll have a really bad trip.

trip.eng_def: a person or experience that is strange or entertaining and exciting
trip.chi_def: 奇怪的，有娛樂性的，令人激動的人（或經歷）
trip.eg: My science teacher is such a trip - he says the most bizarre things.

trip.eng_def: a period of time when you experience a particular feeling strongly
trip.chi_def: 強烈的內疚／擁有權力的快感／極度自負心理
trip.eg: She's been on a real power trip since she became the office manager.

trip.eng_def: to lose your balance after knocking your foot against something when you are walking or running, or to cause someone to do this
trip.eg: He tripped and fell down, grazing his knee.

trip.eng_def: to move with quick, gentle steps
trip.eg: She looked stunning as she tripped down the stairs in her ball gown.

trip.eng_def: to move a switch that operates an electrical system, or to cause such a system to start or stop working by moving a switch
trip.chi_def: 轉動（開關）；轉動開關開動（或關掉）
trip.eg: A special system prevents the circuitry from being tripped accidentally by a power surge or lightning strike.

trip.eng_def: to experience the effects of taking an illegal drug that causes the user to see, hear, or feel things that do not exist
trip.eg: As a student he spent a lot of time tripping out on LSD.

triple.eng_def: having three parts of the same type, or happening three times
triple.eg: Her trainer is a triple Olympic champion.

triple.eng_def: three times as large as something
triple.eg: The number of one-parent households reached 10.1 million in 2011, nearly triple that of 1981.

triple.eng_def: to increase three times in size or amount, or to make something do this
triple.eg: We have tripled our output over the past two years.

triumph.eng_def: a very great success, achievement, or victory (= when you win a war, fight, or competition), or a feeling of great satisfaction or pleasure caused by this
triumph.eg: The book celebrates the hostages' remarkable triumph over appalling adversity.

triumph.eng_def: to have a very great success or victory
triumph.eg: I believe that sooner or later good must triumph over evil.

triumphant.eng_def: having achieved a great victory (= winning a war or competition) or success, or feeling very happy and proud because of such an achievement
triumphant.chi_def: 取得巨大成功的；歡欣鼓舞的；洋洋得意的
triumphant.eg: It seemed as though the whole city had turned out for their team's triumphant homecoming.

trivial.chi_def: 微不足道的，瑣碎的；沒有價值的
trivial.eg: I don't know why he gets so upset about something so trivial.

trivial.eng_def: A trivial problem is easy to solve.
trivial.chi_def: 容易解決的，不費吹灰之力的
trivial.eg: Getting computers to understand human language is not a trivial problem.

troop.eng_def: soldiers on duty in a large group
troop.eg: Traditionally, United Nations troops have been deployed only in a peacekeeping role.

troop.eng_def: a group of soldiers, especially ones who fight in strong military vehicles or on horses
troop.chi_def: 軍隊，部隊；（尤指）裝甲兵部隊，騎兵部隊
troop.eg: the King's Troop of the Royal Horse Artillery

troop.eng_def: an organized group of young people who are Scouts
troop.eg: My brother joined the local Boy Scout troop.

troop.eng_def: for, relating to, or involving troops
troop.chi_def: 軍隊的；有關（或涉及）軍隊的
troop.eg: Satellite photographs provide us with a lot of information about their troop movements.

troop.eng_def: to walk somewhere in a large group, usually with one person behind another
troop.chi_def: 成群結隊地走；（通常指）列隊而行
troop.eg: The little boys trooped after him across the playing fields.

troop.eng_def: to travel somewhere as a group, especially when told to
troop.eg: We all trooped down to London for the meeting.

trophy.eng_def: a prize, such as a gold or silver cup, that is given to the winner of a competition or race, and often returned after a year to be given to the winner of the competition in the following year
trophy.eg: He's an excellent rider, but he's never won a major trophy.

trophy.eng_def: something used as a symbol of success from hunting or war
trophy.chi_def: 戰利品；獵獲物；勝利紀念品
trophy.eg: The animal heads on the wall were trophies of his hunting trips.

tropic.eng_def: one of the two imaginary lines around the earth at approximately 23.5 degrees north and 23.5 degrees south of the equator
the hottest area of the earth, between the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn
tropic.eg: She's a botanist and spent several years doing research in the tropics.

tropical.eng_def: from or relating to the area between the two tropics

tropical.eg: The weather was positively tropical last summer.

trot.eng_def: If a horse or similar animal with four legs trots, it runs at its slowest speed, using short steps in which a front leg and the back leg on the opposite side move together.
trot.eg: She was trotting along on her pony.

trot.eng_def: When people trot somewhere, they go there in a quick or busy way.
trot.eg: She came trotting down the street after me.

trot.eng_def: to speak or do something too quickly
trot.chi_def: 連珠炮似地說；急匆匆地做
trot.eg: She was rather nervous and trotted through her speech a bit too quickly.

trot.eng_def: the speed or movement of a horse or similar animal when it trots
trot.eg: He climbed onto his horse and headed off at a relaxed trot.

trot.eng_def: a slow run by a human
trot.eg: The team warmed up for the match with a trot around the pitch.

trot.eng_def: diarrhoea (= a condition in which the contents of the bowels are emptied too often)

trouble.eg: The tax forms were complicated and I had a lot of trouble with them.

trouble.eng_def: a situation in which you experience problems, usually because of something you have done wrong or badly
trouble.eg: He's never been in trouble with his teachers before.

trouble.eng_def: a characteristic of someone or something that is considered a disadvantage or problem
trouble.eg: The trouble with this carpet is that it gets dirty very easily.

trouble.eng_def: problems or difficulties caused by something failing to operate as it should
trouble.eg: The plane developed engine trouble shortly after take-off.

trouble.eng_def: problems in the form of arguments, fighting, or violence
trouble.eg: Listen, I don't want any trouble in here, so please just finish your drink and leave.
I didn't mean to cause you any trouble.

trouble.eng_def: to cause someone to be worried or nervous
trouble.eg: I asked her what was troubling her, but she didn't want to talk.

trouble.eng_def: to cause someone to have a problem or difficulties
trouble.eg: He has been troubled by a knee injury for most of the season.

trouble.eng_def: to cause someone a small amount of effort
trouble.eg: May I trouble you for (= please give me) some more wine, please?

troublesome.eng_def: causing a lot of problems for someone
troublesome.chi_def: 令人煩惱的；討厭的；麻煩的，棘手的
troublesome.eg: Her hip has been troublesome for quite a while, and she'll probably need surgery on it.

trousers.eng_def: a piece of clothing that covers the lower part of the body from the waist to the feet, consisting of two cylinder-shaped parts, one for each leg, that are joined at the top
trousers.eg: I need a new pair of trousers to go with this jacket.

trout.eng_def: a fish that lives in rivers and lakes, or lives in the sea but returns to rivers to produce its eggs, that is a popular food
trout.eg: Thousands of young salmon and trout have been killed by pollution.

trout.eng_def: the flesh of this fish eaten as food
trout.eg: I had some perfectly cooked trout.

trout.eng_def: an old person, especially a woman, who is unpleasant or not attractive
trout.chi_def: 老傢夥；（尤指）討厭的婆娘，惡婆子
trout.eg: She's a miserable old trout who complains about everything.

truant.eng_def: a child who is regularly absent from school without permission
truant.eg: Police reports showed that the vast majority of crime committed by children was carried out by truants.

truant.eng_def: to be regularly absent from school without permission
truant.eg: Most parents are horrified when they discover their children have been playing truant from school.

truant.eng_def: Children who truant are regularly absent from school, usually while pretending to their parents that they have gone to school
truant.eg: You'll fail all your exams if you carry on truanting.

truce.eng_def: a short interruption in a war or argument, or an agreement to stop fighting or arguing for a period of time
truce.chi_def: 講和（協議）；休戰，停戰（協定）
truce.eg: After years of rivalry the two companies have agreed (US agreed to) a truce.

truck.eng_def: a large road vehicle that is used for transporting large amounts of goods
truck.eg: The road was completely blocked by an overturned truck.

truck.eng_def: a part of a train that is used for carrying goods or animals
truck.eg: Hundreds of refugees were herded into cattle trucks for the gruelling ten-hour journey.

truck.eng_def: to refuse to become involved with something or someone because you do not approve of it, him, or her
truck.chi_def: 拒絕與（某人）交往；不與…打交道

truck.eng_def: to transport something somewhere in a truck
truck.eg: Most of the aid is being trucked into the city, although some is arriving by boat.

trumpet.eng_def: a brass musical instrument consisting of a metal tube with one narrow end, into which the player blows, and one wide end. Three buttons are pressed in order to change notes.
(of a large animal, especially an elephant) to produce a loud call
trumpet.eg: We could hear the elephants trumpeting in the distance.

trumpet.eng_def: to announce or talk about something proudly to a lot of people
trumpet.eg: The museum has been loudly trumpeting its reputation as one of the finest.

trunk.eng_def: the thick main stem of a tree, from which its branches grow
the main part of a person's body, not including the head, legs, or arms
trunk.eg: The statue shows the head, trunk, and arms of an old man.

trunk.eng_def: the main part of a blood vessel or nerve
the long, tube-shaped nose of an elephant
a large, strong container that is used for storing clothes and personal possessions, often when travelling or going to live in a new place
a covered space at the back of a car, for storing things in
trunk.eg: I always keep a blanket and a toolkit in the trunk for emergencies.

trunk.eng_def: a piece of men's clothing that covers the hips and bottom and the top part of the legs and is worn when swimming
a piece of men's underwear that covers the hips and bottom and the top part of the legs
trunk.chi_def: （男式）蓋住臀部和部分大腿的內褲，四角內褲

trust.eng_def: to believe that someone is good and honest and will not harm you, or that something is safe and reliable
trust.eg: My sister warned me not to trust him.

trust.eng_def: to hope and expect that something is true
the belief that you can trust someone or something
trust.eg: a relationship based on trust and understanding

trust.eng_def: to believe that something is true although you have no proof
a legal arrangement in which a person or organization controls property and/or money for another person or organization
trust.eg: Under the terms of the trust he receives interest on the money, but he cannot get at the money itself.

trust.eng_def: an organization that controls property and/or money for another person
trust.eg: He works for a charitable trust.

trust.eng_def: used in the name of some banks

truth.eg: There would seem to be some truth in what she says.

truth.eng_def: the real facts about a situation, event, or person
truth.eg: But was he telling the truth?

truth.eng_def: used to show or emphasize that something is true
truth.eg: In truth we feared for her safety, although we didn't let it be known.

truth.eng_def: a fact or principle that is thought to be true by most people
truth.eg: It would seem to be a general truth that nothing is as straightforward as it at first seems.

truthful.eng_def: honest and not containing or telling any lies
truthful.chi_def: 誠實的；講真話的；真實的，如實的
truthful.eg: The public has a right to expect truthful answers from politicians.

try.eg: Keep trying and you'll find a job eventually.

try.eng_def: to test something to see if it is suitable or useful or if it works
try.eg: I tried that recipe you gave me last night.

try.eng_def: used by many people and proved to be effective
try.chi_def: 經反復考驗證實是有效的
try.eg: Most people would prefer to stick to tried and tested methods of birth control.

try.eng_def: to examine a person accused of committing a crime in a law court by asking them questions and considering known facts, and then decide if they are guilty
try.eg: Because of security implications the officers were tried in secret.

try.eng_def: to worry or annoy someone or upset a person's patience with many, often slight, difficulties
try.eg: The demands of the job have tried him sorely.
They might still have tickets left - why don't you give it a try?

try.eng_def: (in the game of rugby) the act of a player putting the ball on the ground behind the opposing team's goal line, which scores points for the player's team
try.chi_def: （橄欖球運動中）在對方球門線後帶球觸地得分

tub.eng_def: a large, round container with a flat base and an open top
tub.eg: Outside was a stone patio with tubs of flowering plants.

tub.eng_def: a small plastic container with a lid, used for storing food
tub.chi_def: （盛食物的塑膠有蓋）小桶，小杯

tub.eng_def: a long plastic, metal, or ceramic container that is filled with water so that you can sit or lie in it to wash your whole body
tub.eg: It's good to sink into a nice, hot tub at the end of a hard day's work.

tub.eng_def: to fill a bath with water for washing
tub.eg: I'll fill the tub for you while you take off those wet clothes.

tube.eng_def: a long cylinder made from plastic, metal, rubber, or glass, especially used for moving or containing liquids or gases
tube.chi_def: （塑膠、金屬、橡膠或玻璃製成的）管，管子
tube.eg: Gases produced in the reaction pass through this tube and can then be collected.

tube.eng_def: in biology, any hollow, cylinder-shaped structure in the body that carries air or liquid
a long, thin container made of soft metal or plastic that is closed at one end and has a small hole at the other, usually with a cover, used for storing thick liquids
tube.chi_def: （由軟金屬或塑膠製成的通常有蓋的，盛膏狀物的）軟管

tube.eng_def: informal for a can or bottle of beer
tube.chi_def: 一罐（或一瓶）啤酒（a can of beer 或 a bottle of beer 的非正式說法）

tube.eg: I got the Tube to Camden Town.
What's on the tube this weekend?

tuberculosis.eng_def: a serious infectious disease that can attack many parts of a person's body, especially their lungs

tuck.eng_def: to push a loose end of a piece of clothing or material into a particular place or position, especially to make it tidy or comfortable
tuck.eg: Should I tuck my shirt into my trousers?

tuck.eng_def: to put something into a safe or convenient place
tuck.eg: Tuck your gloves in your pocket so that you don't lose them.

tuck.eng_def: to hold part of your body in a particular position
tuck.eg: Stand up straight, tuck your tummy in and tuck your bottom under.

tuck.eng_def: to be in a place that is hidden or where few people go
tuck.eg: Tucked along/down this alley are some beautiful old houses.

tuck.eng_def: a narrow fold sewn into something, especially a piece of material, either for decoration or to change its shape
tuck.chi_def: （用於裝飾或改變形狀的）褶；打褶

tuck.eng_def: an operation to remove unwanted fat from a part of the body

tug.eng_def: to pull something quickly and usually with a lot of force
tug.eg: Tom tugged at his mother's arm.

tug.eng_def: a boat with a powerful engine that can change direction easily and is used to pull large ships into and out of port
a sudden strong pull on something
tug.eg: Feeling a tug at his sleeve, he turned to see Joe beside him.

tug-of-war.eng_def: a type of sport in which two teams show their strength by pulling against each other at the opposite ends of a rope, and each team tries to pull the other over a line on the ground

tuition.eng_def: teaching, especially when given to a small group or one person, such as in a college or university
tuition.chi_def: （尤指一對一或小班進行的）教學，講授，指導
tuition.eg: All students receive tuition in logic and metaphysics.

tuition.eng_def: the money paid for this type of teaching
tuition.eg: Few can afford the tuition of $12,000 a semester.

tulip.eng_def: a plant with a large, brightly coloured, bell-shaped flower on a stem that grows from a bulb, or the flower itself

tumble.eng_def: to fall quickly and without control
tumble.eg: I lost my footing and tumbled down the stairs.

tumble.eng_def: to fall a lot in value in a short time
to move in an uncontrolled way, as if falling or likely to fall
tumble.eg: An excited group of children tumbled out of school/the bus.
She took a nasty tumble on her way to work and grazed her arm.

tummy.eng_def: the stomach, or the lower front part of the body

tumor.eng_def: a mass of diseased cells that might become a lump or cause illness
tumor.eg: They found a malignant tumour in her breast.

tuna.eng_def: a large fish that lives in warm seas
the flesh of this fish eaten as food

tune.eng_def: a series of musical notes, especially one that is pleasant and easy to remember
tune.eg: He was humming a tune as he dried the dishes.

tune.eng_def: singing or playing notes that are at the right pitch (= level) or that agree with others being sung or played
singing or playing notes that are at the wrong pitch (= level) or that do not agree with others being sung or played
tune.eg: The piano is out of tune.

tune.eng_def: If you are in tune with people or ideas, you understand or agree with them, and if you are out of tune with them, you do not.
tune.chi_def: 與…協調／不協調，與…相／不相契合
tune.eg: Much of his success comes from being in tune with what his customers want.
The City Council had financed the new building to the tune of over four million pounds.

tune.eng_def: to change a part of a musical instrument so that the instrument produces the correct sounds when played
tune.eg: Get into the habit of tuning your guitar every day before you practise.

tune.eng_def: to move the controls on a radio, television, etc. so that it receives programmes broadcast from a particular station
tune.chi_def: 給（收音機、電視等）調諧，為…調頻率，調頻道
tune.eg: Press this button and the video will automatically tune itself to the next channel.

tune.eng_def: to make slight changes to an engine so that it works as well as possible
tune.chi_def: 把（發動機）調試到最佳運轉狀態
tune.eg: The engine needs tuning, but there's nothing wrong with the car.

tunnel.eng_def: a long passage under or through the ground, especially one made by people
tunnel.eg: The train went into the tunnel.

tunnel.eng_def: the long passage through which football, rugby etc. players walk to get to the pitch
tunnel.chi_def: （足球或橄欖球等比賽時球員走向球場的）球員通道

tunnel.eg: The decision has not yet been made whether to tunnel under the river or build a bridge over it.

turkey.eng_def: a large bird grown for its meat on farms
the flesh of this bird used as food

turkey.eg: His last film was a complete turkey.
What did you do that for, you turkey?

turkey.eng_def: a country in southeastern Europe and Western Asia
turkey.chi_def: 土耳其（橫跨歐洲西南部和西亞的國家）

turmoil.eng_def: a state of confusion, uncertainty, or disorder
turmoil.eg: The whole region is in turmoil.

turn.eng_def: to (cause to) move in a circle around a fixed point or line
turn.eg: The earth turns on its axis once every 24 hours.

turn.eng_def: to (cause to) change the direction in which you are facing or moving
turn.eg: Turn right at the traffic lights.

turn.eng_def: to move, or to move an object or page, so that a different side or surface is on the top
turn.chi_def: 翻動（書頁）；（使）翻轉；（使）翻身
turn.eg: Now turn the page, please, and start work on Exercise 2.

turn.eng_def: to (cause to) become, change into, or come to be something
turn.eg: The weather has suddenly turned cold.

turn.eng_def: to become a particular age or time
to use a control to switch a piece of equipment or a power or water supply on or off, or to increase or reduce what it is producing
turn.chi_def: 旋動，擰動（操縱裝置）；（為升高或降低…而）旋動，擰動

turn.eng_def: to damage the muscles in the foot by suddenly twisting it too strongly
turn.eg: She turned her ankle on the rocks and had to hobble back to camp.

turn.eng_def: to shape a piece of wood while it is attached to a machine that spins it
an opportunity or a duty to do something at a particular time or in a particular order, before or after other people
When a number of people take turns, they do the same thing one after the other.
turn.eg: We take turns answering the phone.

turn.eng_def: one after the other in an agreed order
turn.eg: Each of us takes a break in turn.

turn.eng_def: an action that causes something to move in a circle round a fixed point
turn.eg: Give the screw a couple of turns to make sure it's tight.

turn.eng_def: a change in the direction in which you are moving or facing
turn.eg: When you see the school on the left, make a right turn.

turn.eng_def: Something that is on the turn is about to change direction.
turn.chi_def: 即將轉變的，正要轉變的
turn.eg: The tide is on the turn.

turn.eng_def: the point at which something changes or moves in a different direction
to develop in a particular way
turn.eg: The battle for control of the company took an interesting turn today.

turn.eng_def: to suddenly become better or worse
turn.eg: Their relationship took a turn for the worse when he lost his job.
The first couple of turns were children singing and dancing.

turn.eng_def: a slight illness, a strange feeling, or a nervous shock
turn.chi_def: 不適感；奇怪的感覺；一驚，一嚇
turn.eg: After the accident I started having funny turns.

turtle.eng_def: an animal which lives in or near water and has a thick shell covering its body into which it can move its head and legs for protection

tutor.eng_def: a teacher who teaches a child outside of school, especially in order to give the child extra help with a subject they find difficult
tutor.eg: His parents got him a tutor to help with his maths.

tutor.eng_def: a teacher at a British college or university who teaches one student or a small group
tutor.chi_def: （英國大學或學院的）導師，教師
tutor.eg: His tutor encouraged him to read widely in philosophy.

twelve.eg: The cafeteria opens for lunch at twelve (o'clock).

twig.eng_def: a small, thin branch of a tree or bush, especially one removed from the tree or bush and without any leaves
twig.eg: We collected dry twigs to start the fire.
Then he twigged what I meant.

twilight.eng_def: the period just before it becomes completely dark in the evening
twilight.eg: I could make out a dark figure in the twilight.

twilight.eng_def: the final part of a period
twilight.eg: I knew him when he was in the twilight of his career.

twilight.eng_def: used to describe a way of life that involves illegal or immoral activities, and is on the edge of normal society
twilight.chi_def: （生活）處於社會邊緣的，不安穩的
twilight.eg: The remaining inhabitants of this once-prosperous town have got used to a twilight existence.

twin.eng_def: either of two children born to the same mother on the same occasion
one of two very similar things
twin.chi_def: 兩個極相似的事物之一
twin.eg: The two countries are often regarded as economic twins.

twin.eng_def: used to describe two similar things that are a pair

twin.eg: his twin obsessions - women and cars

twin.eng_def: If a town in one country is twinned with a town in another country, the two towns have a special relationship.

twinkle.eng_def: (of light or a shiny surface) to shine repeatedly strongly then weakly, as if flashing on and off very quickly
twinkle.eg: The lights of the town twinkled in the distance.

twist.eng_def: to turn something, especially repeatedly, or to turn or wrap one thing around another
twist.eg: The path twists and turns for over a mile.

twist.eng_def: If you twist a part of your body, such as your ankle, you injure it by suddenly turning it.
twist.eg: She slipped on the ice and twisted her knee.

twist.eng_def: to change information so that it gives the message you want it to give, especially in a way that is dishonest
twist.eg: This report shows how she twisted the truth to claim successes where none, in fact, existed.
She gave the cap another twist to make sure it was tight.

twist.eng_def: the shape of or a piece of something that has been twisted
twist.chi_def: 螺旋狀（物）；麻花狀（物）；辮子形（物）

twist.eg: a path with many twists and turns

twist.eng_def: a change in the way in which something happens
twist.eg: The story took a surprise twist today with media reports that the doctor had resigned.

twist.eng_def: a complicated situation or plan of action
twist.chi_def: 複雜的形勢；複雜的行動計劃
twist.eg: the twists and turns of fate

twist.eng_def: a dance in which people stay in one place and twist their bodies from side to side to music

type.eng_def: a particular group of people or things that share similar characteristics and form a smaller division of a larger set
type.eg: There were so many different types of bread that I didn't know which to buy.

type.eng_def: a person who seems to represent a particular group of people, having all the qualities that you usually connect with that group
type.eg: He doesn't use fully rounded characters in his plays - he uses types.

type.eng_def: to be the type of person that someone thinks is attractive
type.chi_def: 是（某人）喜歡的那種類型
type.eg: He's a nice enough guy - he's just not my type.

type.eng_def: the style and size of printed letters used in a piece of printed writing such as in a newspaper, book, or article
type.eg: Use bold type for your headings.

type.eng_def: to write using a machine, either a computer keyboard or a typewriter
type.chi_def: （用電腦鍵盤或打字機等）打字
type.eg: She asked me to type a couple of letters.

typewriter.eng_def: a machine with keys that you press to produce letters and numbers on paper
typewriter.eg: He still uses an old typewriter.

typhoon.eng_def: a violent wind that has a circular movement, found in the West Pacific Ocean
typhoon.eg: The 169,000-ton vessel went down during a typhoon in the South China Sea.

typical.eng_def: showing all the characteristics that you would usually expect from a particular group of things
typical.eg: I must look like the typical tourist with my shorts and my camera.

typical.eng_def: showing all the bad characteristics that you expect from someone or something, often in a way that is annoying
typical.chi_def: （不良品質等）特有的，一向如此的，不出所料的
typical.eg: It's just typical of Dan to spend all that money on the equipment and then lose interest two months later.

typist.eng_def: used to say how good someone is at typing
a person whose job is to type letters, reports, and other documents

tyranny.eng_def: government by a ruler or small group of people who have unlimited power over the people in their country or state and use it unfairly and cruelly
tyranny.eg: This, the president promised us, was a war against tyranny.

tyranny.eng_def: a situation in which someone or something controls how you are able to live, in an unfair way
tyranny.eg: Women, the play seems to suggest, must resist the tyranny of domesticity.

tyrant.eng_def: a ruler who has unlimited power over other people, and uses it unfairly and cruelly
tyrant.chi_def: 暴君；暴虐的人；專橫的人
tyrant.eg: Tamir, one of several sons of the exiled ruler, vowed he would liberate his country from the tyrant.

ugly.eng_def: unpleasant to look at; not attractive
ugly.eg: I think a lot of modern architecture is very ugly.
There were ugly scenes outside the stadium.

ulcer.eng_def: a break in the skin, or on the surface of an organ inside the body, that does not heal naturally

ultimate.eng_def: most extreme or important because either the original or final, or the best or worst
ultimate.chi_def: 極端的；最重要的；最初（或終）的；最好（差）的
ultimate.eg: Of course the ultimate responsibility for the present conflict without doubt lies with the aggressor.

ultimate.eng_def: the best or most extreme example of something
ultimate.chi_def: …中最好的例子；…的極致；…中的極品
ultimate.eg: The hotel is described as "the ultimate in luxury".

umbrella.eng_def: a device for protection against the rain, consisting of a stick with a folding frame covered in material at one end and usually a handle at the other, or a similar, often larger, device used for protection against the sun
umbrella.eg: I felt a few drops of rain, so I put my umbrella up.

umbrella.eng_def: something that includes or represents a group or range of similar things
umbrella.eg: He runs a group of companies under the umbrella of Universal Foods.

umpire.eng_def: a person who is present at a sports competition in order to make certain that the rules of that particular game are obeyed and to judge if particular actions are acceptable

unanimous.eng_def: If a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about one particular matter or vote the same way, and if a decision or judgment is unanimous, it is formed or supported by everyone in a group.
unanimous.chi_def: （團體）意見一致的；（決定或裁決）一致通過的，獲得全體支援的
unanimous.eg: The jury returned a unanimous verdict of guilty after a short deliberation.

uncle.eng_def: the brother of someone's mother or father, or the husband of someone's aunt or uncle
uncle.chi_def: 舅父；伯父；叔父；姨父；姑父
uncle.eg: I have lots of uncles and aunts.

uncle.eng_def: any male adult that you know who is older than you
uncle.chi_def: 叔叔，大叔（任何年紀比自己大的成年男性）

uncover.eng_def: to discover something secret or hidden or remove something covering something else
uncover.chi_def: 揭露，發現（秘密或隱藏物）；揭開（覆蓋物）
uncover.eg: The investigation uncovered evidence of a large-scale illegal trade in wild birds.

uncover.eng_def: to find something buried under the ground by removing the earth on top of it
uncover.eg: Digging in her garden, she uncovered a hoard of gold dating back to the ninth century.

under.eng_def: in or to a position below or lower than something else, often so that one thing covers the other
under.chi_def: 在（或到）下面；在（或到）下方

under.eng_def: If a piece of land is under a particular type of plant, that plant is growing on the whole of that area.
under.eg: The main fields are under wheat.

under.eng_def: If a book, article, or piece of information is under a particular title, you can find it below or following that title in a list, book, library, etc.
under.chi_def: （書、文章或資訊）屬於…類別，在…項下
under.eg: Books on Ansel Adams will probably be under Art or Photography.
All items cost/are under a pound.

under.eng_def: happening during, as a result of, or according to a particular situation, event, rule, etc.
under.eg: The work was completed under very difficult conditions.

under.eng_def: in the process of being attacked, considered, discussed, etc.
under.chi_def: 遭受攻擊／正在考慮／正在討論（等等）
under.eg: The town is under fire (= is being attacked) from the air.

under.chi_def: 處於鎮靜劑／麻醉劑的作用之下
under.eg: The patient is being kept under heavy sedation.
He was under the mistaken belief that I was in charge.

under.eng_def: controlled or governed by a particular person, organization, or force
under.eg: He's a Colonel, with hundreds of soldiers under him (= obeying his orders).

under.eng_def: to have been ordered to do something
under.eg: They're under strict orders not to discuss the situation.

under.eng_def: using a particular name, especially one that is not your real name
under.eg: He writes under the name (of) John le Carré.
Because I'm a bad swimmer, I often go under and swallow a lot of water.

under.eng_def: not enough or not done as well or as much as is necessary

underestimate.eng_def: to fail to guess or understand the real cost, size, difficulty, etc. of something
underestimate.eg: Originally the contractor gave me a price of €2,000, but now they say they underestimated and it's going to be at least €3,000.

underestimate.eng_def: to fail to understand how strong, skilful, intelligent, or determined someone, especially a competitor, is
underestimate.chi_def: 低估，輕視（尤指競爭對手）

undergo.eng_def: to experience something that is unpleasant or something that involves a change
undergo.chi_def: 經歷，經受（令人不快的事或變化）
undergo.eg: She underwent an operation on a tumour in her left lung last year.

undergraduate.eng_def: a student who is studying for their first degree at a college or university

underground.eng_def: below the surface of the earth; below ground
underground.chi_def: 在地下（的），在地面以下的

underground.eng_def: An underground activity is secret and usually illegal.
a secret system, used in the 19th century, by which slaves (= people who had been sold and forced to work) in the southern US were helped to escape to places where there was no slavery
underground.chi_def: （十九世紀在美國用來幫助南方黑奴逃脫至廢除了黑奴制度地區的）地下鐵路

underground.eng_def: a railway system in which electric trains travel through tunnels below ground
people in a society who are trying new and often shocking or illegal ways of living or forms of art
underground.eg: In Britain and the USA in the 1970s, the underground was a powerful subversive force.

underground.eng_def: a group of people who secretly fight against the government
underground.eg: He was a member of the underground, harassing the invading army.

underline.eng_def: to draw a line under a word, especially in order to show its importance
underline.chi_def: （尤指爲了強調）在（詞語）下面畫線
underline.eg: All the technical words have been underlined in red.
She gave some shocking examples to underline the seriousness of the situation.

undermine.eng_def: to make someone less confident, less powerful, or less likely to succeed, or to make something weaker, often gradually
undermine.chi_def: （常指逐漸地）削弱信心、權威等，損害
undermine.eg: The president has accused two cabinet members of working secretly to undermine his position/him.

underneath.eg: The tunnel goes right underneath the city.

underneath.eng_def: the lower part or the bottom surface of something
underneath.eg: Bake for half an hour - the top should be crisp, and the underneath moist and succulent.

underpass.eng_def: a road or path that goes under something such as a busy road, allowing vehicles or people to go from one side to the other

understand.eng_def: to know the meaning of something that someone says
understand.eg: She explained the whole idea again, but I still didn't understand.

understand.eng_def: to know why or how something happens or works
understand.eg: We still don't fully understand how the brain works.

understand.eng_def: to know how someone feels or why someone behaves in a particular way
to think, especially wrongly, that someone means a particular thing
understand.chi_def: （尤指錯誤地）把（某人）的意思理解爲…
understand.eg: When he said three o'clock, I understood him to mean in the afternoon.

understand.eng_def: When two people understand one another, they both know what the other means and wants and they have an agreement.
understand.eg: I wanted to make sure that we want the same things, that we really understand each other.

understand.eng_def: to know or realize something because you have been told it
understand.eg: I understand (that) you are interested in borrowing some money from us.

understand.eng_def: used when making certain that someone knows what you mean and will do as you want
understand.chi_def: （用於詢問他人是否明白自己所表達的意思並按要求去做）明白
understand.eg: I don't want you to see that boy again. Understand?/Do you understand?/Is that understood?

understand.eng_def: used to refer to something such as a rule that everyone knows and accepts
understand.eg: In the library it is understood that people should talk quietly.

understandable.eg: You have to put the facts into a form that's understandable to everyone.

understandable.eng_def: You say that something, for example someone's behaviour, is understandable, if you feel that it is usual and not strange or difficult to understand
understandable.chi_def: 合乎情理的；正常的；可以理解的
understandable.eg: Their refusal to cooperate is perfectly/completely understandable, considering the circumstances.

undertake.eng_def: to do or begin to do something, especially something that will take a long time or be difficult
undertake.chi_def: （開始）做，承擔，從事（尤指耗時或困難之事）
undertake.eg: Students are required to undertake simple experiments.

undertake.eng_def: to promise that you will do something
undertake.eg: She undertook not to publish the names of the people involved.

underwear.eng_def: clothes worn next to the skin, under other clothes

undo.eng_def: to unfasten something that is fastened or tied
undo.eg: Can someone help me to undo my seat belt?

undo.eng_def: to remove the good or bad effects of an action or several actions
undo.eg: I did a really tough aerobics class and then went out for dinner and undid (all) the good work!

unemployment.eng_def: the number of people who do not have a job that provides money
unemployment.eg: Unemployment has fallen/risen again for the third consecutive month.

unemployment.chi_def: 失業救濟金，失業津貼（同 unemployment benefit）

unfold.eng_def: to open or spread out something that has been folded
unfold.eg: He watched her expression as she unfolded the letter.

unfold.eng_def: If a situation or story unfolds, it develops or becomes clear to other people.
unfold.chi_def: （形勢或故事）發展，展現，呈現，披露
unfold.eg: Like a lot of people, I've watched the events of the last few days unfold on TV.

unfold.eng_def: to tell a story or explain something such as a plan
unfold.eg: Gradually, the author unfolds a fantastical tale.

uniform.eng_def: a particular set of clothes that has to be worn by the members of the same organization or group of people
a type of clothes that is connected with a particular group of people
uniform.chi_def: （某一群體的人穿的）典型服裝，特有服裝
uniform.eg: Photographs show him wearing the T-shirt and ripped jeans that were the student's uniform of the time.

uniform.eng_def: the same; not changing or different in any way
uniform.chi_def: 相同的；一律的；整齊劃一的
uniform.eg: The office walls and furniture are a uniform grey.

unify.eg: If the new leader does manage to unify his warring party it will be quite an achievement.

union.eng_def: the act or the state of being joined together
union.eg: Meanwhile the debate on European political and monetary union continues.

union.eng_def: (in the American Civil War) the states that did not separate from the United States

unique.eng_def: being the only existing one of its type or, more generally, unusual, or special in some way
unique.chi_def: 獨一無二的；與眾不同的；唯一的；獨特的；罕見的
unique.eg: Each person's genetic code is unique except in the case of identical twins.

unit.eng_def: a single thing or a separate part of something larger
unit.eg: Each unit of the text book focuses on a different grammar point.

unit.eng_def: a piece of furniture or equipment that is intended to be fitted as a part of a set of similar or matching pieces
a small machine or part of a machine that has a particular purpose
unit.eg: the central processing unit of a computer

unit.eng_def: a single complete product of the type that a business sells
a single apartment in a bigger building
unit.eg: The old house has been divided up into three rental units.

unit.eng_def: a group of people living or working together, especially for a particular purpose
unit.chi_def: （尤指具有特定目的的）班組，小隊

unit.eng_def: a standard measure that is used to express amounts
unit.eg: A centimetre is a unit of length.
Experts say that women should not drink more than 14 units of alcohol a week.

unit.eng_def: a department in a hospital for the treatment of people with similar illnesses or conditions
any whole number less than ten
unit.eg: Tens go in the left-hand column and units in the right.

unite.eng_def: to join together as a group, or to make people join together as a group; to combine
unite.eg: If the opposition groups unite, they may will command over 55 percent of the vote.

unity.eng_def: the state of being joined together or in agreement

universe.eng_def: everything that exists, especially all physical matter, including all the stars, planets, galaxies, etc. in space
universe.eg: Is there intelligent life elsewhere in the universe?

universe.eng_def: a universe that could be imagined to exist outside our own
universe.chi_def: （想像中的）人類世界以外的另一個世界
universe.eg: Scientists have speculated about the possibility of parallel universes.

universe.eng_def: the world, or the world that you are familiar with
universe.eg: The characters in his novels inhabit a bleak and hopeless universe.

university.eng_def: a place where people people study for an undergraduate (= first) or postgraduate (= higher level) degree
university.eg: Which university did you go to/were you at (= did you study at)?

unless.eg: You can't get a job unless you have experience (= you can only get a job if you have experience).

unlock.eng_def: to open something, especially a door that is locked (= fastened with a lock) using a key or an electronic device
unlock.chi_def: 打開；（尤指用鎖匙或電子設備）開（門）
unlock.eg: I think I left the garage door unlocked.

unlock.eng_def: to discover important new facts about something
unlock.eg: A chemical has been discovered that may be the key to unlocking the mysteries of Parkinson's disease.

unlock.eng_def: to make the imagination more active, producing interesting ideas and images
unlock.eg: One of poetry's functions is to unlock the imagination.

unpack.eng_def: to remove things from a suitcase, bag, or box
unpack.chi_def: 從（箱、包）中取出；打開行李箱
unpack.eg: I haven't even had time to unpack (my suitcase/clothes).

unpack.eng_def: to explain or examine something in order to make its meaning clearer
unpack.eg: He read the agreed statement to the group and then began to unpack it for them.

until.eg: I was up until three o'clock trying to get it finished!

until.eng_def: not before a particular time or event
until.eg: We didn't eat till past midnight.
You should stay on the train until Manchester and then change.

up.eng_def: towards a higher position; towards a higher value, number, or level
up.chi_def: 向較高處；向上；（價值、數位或水準）加大地；增高地
up.eg: Put those books up on the top shelf.

up.eng_def: out of the ground
up.eg: He spent the afternoon digging carrots up.

up.eng_def: from a higher to a lower position repeatedly
up.chi_def: 起起伏伏地，上上下下地
up.eg: My little girl started jumping up and down with rage when she heard she couldn't go.

up.eng_def: in or into a vertical position
up.chi_def: 處於直立狀態地；垂直地
up.eg: Would you stand up for a minute? I want to see how tall you are.

up.eng_def: in a high position; at the top
up.eg: Our boardroom is up on the 23rd floor.

up.eng_def: very near
up.eg: Carrying a gun, he walked up to the cashier and demanded money.

up.eng_def: to a greater degree; in order to increase
up.chi_def: 由弱到強地；由低到高地
up.eg: The fire heats the room up (= makes it warmer) within minutes.

up.eng_def: If a level or amount is up, it has increased.
up.eg: The cost of car insurance is up, but not very much.

up.eng_def: not in bed
up.eg: It's time to get up now!

up.eng_def: to be able to get out of bed and move around again after a period of illness, because your health has improved enough
into existence, view, or attention
up.chi_def: （表示出現、發生、看到、給予考慮等）
up.eg: Originally the charity was set up to help orphans in urban areas.

up.eng_def: so as to be equal in quality, knowledge, or achievement
up.chi_def: （在品質、知識或成就方面）相等，比得上
up.eg: She couldn't go to school for a few weeks because of illness, but she'll be able to catch up (with her work) quickly.

up.eng_def: in a state of being together with other similar things
up.eg: You have half an hour to gather up anything you'll need for the journey.

up.eng_def: tightly or firmly in order to keep something safe or in position
up.eg: Tie up the top of the bag so the rubbish doesn't fall out.

up.eng_def: broken or cut into smaller pieces; made smaller in area
up.eg: He cut the letter up into a hundred pieces.

up.eng_def: to a greater age
up.eg: No one said that growing up would be easy or painless.

up.eng_def: used when talking or asking about what is happening
up.chi_def: （用於談論或詢問發生了甚麽事）
up.eg: Everyone was talking in whispers, and I could tell something was up (= something unusual was happening).

up.eng_def: When a period of time is up, it is finished.
up.eg: When the two hours were up nobody had answered all of the questions.

up.eng_def: into an improved position or state
up.eg: By lap 26, Hamilton had moved up into second position.

up.eng_def: to an end, finish, or state of being complete
up.eg: Finish up the old loaf of bread before you start a new one.

up.eng_def: towards the north
up.eg: On Tuesday she'll be travelling up to Atlanta from New Orleans.

up.eng_def: towards a more important place, especially a city
up.chi_def: 往更重要的地方（尤指城市）
up.eg: How often do you go up to London?

up.eng_def: intended, suggested, or being considered for something
up.chi_def: 計劃要；被建議；正被考慮
up.eg: That house at the end of our road is up for sale again.

up.eng_def: willing and able to do or take part in an activity
up.eg: After a long day at work I wasn't really up for a party.

up.eng_def: on trial in a court
up.eg: If he doesn't pay the fine soon, he'll be up before the magistrate.

up.eng_def: When a road is up, it is being repaired and so is unsuitable for use.
up.eg: The council has got the road up because of a broken sewer.

up.eng_def: If someone's long hair is up, it is arranged on the top or back of the head.
up.eg: You look nice with your hair up.

up.eng_def: to or in a higher level or position
up.chi_def: 在（或向）較高水準（或位置）
up.eg: We followed her up the stairs to a large meeting room.

up.eng_def: at the top of
up.eg: You'll find a dusty attic up these stairs.

up.eng_def: (further) along
up.eg: The car shot off up the road at high speed.

up.eng_def: along the surface of something first in one direction and then in the opposite direction, usually repeatedly
up.eg: He was running up and down the street, shouting.

up.eng_def: towards the starting point of something, especially a river or stream
up.chi_def: 向起點；（尤指）向上游；向發源地
up.eg: Rowing up (the) river against the current was very hard work.

up.eng_def: to or at
up.eg: Are you going up the club tonight?

up.eng_def: moving up
up.eg: an up escalator

up.eng_def: When a system, computer, or similar machine is up, it is operating, especially in its usual way.
up.chi_def: （尤指以正常狀態）在運轉，在運行
up.eg: Andy, do you know when the network will be up again?

up.eng_def: feeling happy
up.eg: She's been really up since she started her new job.

up.eng_def: to increase something such as a price
up.eg: We won't be able to make a profit on the deal without upping the sale price.

up.eng_def: used with another verb to emphasize that someone left a place or did something in a sudden and possibly unexpected way
up.chi_def: （與另一動詞連用，強調突然或者出人意料地離開或做某事）
up.eg: After dinner they just upped and left/went without saying goodbye.

up.eng_def: higher or improved
up.eg: uphill

upbringing.eng_def: the way in which you are treated and educated when young, especially by your parents, especially in relation to the effect that this has on how you behave and make moral decisions
upbringing.eg: Is it right to say all the crimes he committed were simply the result of his upbringing?

update.eng_def: to make something more modern or suitable for use now by adding new information or changing its design
update.eg: an updated version of the software

update.eng_def: to give someone the most recent information
update.eg: We'll update you on this news story throughout the day.

update.eng_def: an act of updating something or someone with new information
update.eg: Jo's just doing an update on the mailing list.

update.eng_def: a new form of something that existed at an earlier time
update.eg: It's an update of an old 60s movie.

upgrade.eng_def: to improve the quality or usefulness of something, such as a machine or a computer program, or give a person a more important job or state that their job is more important than it was in the past
upgrade.chi_def: 使（機器、電腦程式等）升級；提升，提拔（某人）
upgrade.eg: It's very simple to upgrade the indexing software.

upgrade.eng_def: a piece of software or equipment that improves the quality or usefulness of a computer or machine
upgrade.chi_def: （能提高電腦等效能的）軟體（或設備）

uphold.eng_def: to defend or keep a principle or law, or to say that a decision that has already been made, especially a legal one, is correct
uphold.chi_def: 支援，維護，贊成（尤指法律上的決議）
uphold.eg: As a police officer you are expected to uphold the law whether you agree with it or not.

upload.eng_def: to copy or move programs or information to a larger computer system or to the internet
a computer program or information that can be uploaded

upon.eg: Upon her head she wore a black velvet hat.

upon.eng_def: to be something that someone will experience or have to deal with soon
upon.eg: Another few weeks and spring will be upon us.

upper.eng_def: at a higher position or level than something else, or being the top part of something
upper.chi_def: （位置或水準）較高的，較上的；上層的
upper.eg: The office building's upper floors were being repainted.

upper.eng_def: the top part of a shoe that covers a person's foot and to which the heel and the sole are attached
upper.eg: These shoes have leather uppers and synthetic soles.

upper.eng_def: a drug that causes a person taking it to feel very active and excited

upright.eg: Please return your seat to an upright position and fasten your belt.

upright.eng_def: used to refer to something that is taller than it is wide

upright.eg: She behaved as any upright citizen would have under the circumstances.

upright.eng_def: vertical and as straight as possible
a vertical part of something that supports other parts
upright.chi_def: （起支撐作用的）直柱，立柱，直立部分
upright.eg: Firmly secure the two uprights to opposite walls in the alcove and then fit the shelves in between them.

upright.chi_def: 球門柱（goalpost 的非正式說法）

upright.eng_def: a piano in which the strings are vertical

upset.eng_def: to make someone worried, unhappy, or angry
upset.chi_def: 使心煩意亂；使難過；使生氣
upset.eg: It still upsets him when he thinks about the accident.

upset.eng_def: to change the usual or expected state or order of something, especially in a way that stops it from happening or working
upset.eg: Any mechanical problems would upset our plans of driving across the desert.

upset.eng_def: to push or knock something out of its usual position, usually by accident, especially causing it to fall
upset.eg: Our dog upset the picnic table, spilling food everywhere.

upset.eng_def: to make someone feel slightly sick
upset.eg: He can't eat grapes - they upset him/his stomach.

upset.chi_def: 使心煩意亂；使難過；使生氣
upset.eg: Don't get upset about the dress - there's only a little stain on it.

upset.eng_def: If you have an upset stomach you feel slightly ill, especially because of something you have eaten or drunk.
upset.chi_def: 形容肚子不舒服（尤其因為吃喝的東西引起的不適）
upset.eg: I have an upset stomach/tummy - serves me right for eating so much.
How much upset will the new monitoring procedures cause?

upset.eng_def: an occasion when someone beats the team or player that was expected to win
upset.eg: It would be quite an upset if the favourite didn't win.

upset.eng_def: a slight illness of the stomach
upset.eg: Melanie has a stomach/tummy upset so she won't be going to school today.

upstairs.eng_def: towards or on the highest floor or floors of a building

upward.eng_def: moving towards a higher position, level, or value
upward.chi_def: 向上的，朝上的；向高處的
upward.eg: With an upward trend in inflation, you expect prices to rise.

upwards.eng_def: towards a higher position, level, or value
upwards.eg: She turned her face upwards to the sun.

uranium.eng_def: a chemical element that is a heavy, radioactive metal, used in the production of nuclear power and in some types of nuclear weapon

urban.eng_def: of or in a city or town

urge.eng_def: a strong wish, especially one that is difficult or impossible to control
urge.chi_def: （尤指難以或無法控制的）慾望，衝動
urge.eg: The two of them seem unable to control their sexual urges.

urge.eng_def: to strongly advise or try to persuade someone to do a particular thing
urge.eg: Lawyers will urge the parents to take further legal action.

urgent.eng_def: needing attention very soon, especially before anything else, because important
urgent.eg: He's got to sign that paper - will you tell him it's urgent?

urgent.eng_def: (especially of a person's actions) repeated and determined in trying to get or do something
urgent.chi_def: （尤指某人的行動）執著的，堅定的
urgent.eg: His urgent pleas of innocence made no difference to the judge's decision.

urine.eng_def: the yellowish liquid waste that is released from the body when you urinate

usage.eng_def: the way a particular word in a language, or a language in general, is used
usage.eg: a guide to common English usage

usage.eng_def: the way something is treated or used
usage.eg: Sports equipment is designed to withstand hard usage.

usage.eng_def: the bad and unfair way someone treats you
usage.eg: Many had complained about the usage they'd received at his hands.

use.eng_def: to put something such as a tool, skill, or building to a particular purpose
use.eg: This glass has been used - could you get me a clean one?

use.eng_def: to reduce the amount of or finish something, by eating it, burning it, writing on it, or by a chemical reaction
use.eg: We've used (up) nearly all of the bread - will you buy some more?

use.eng_def: to say or write a particular word or phrase
use.chi_def: 說或寫（特定的單詞或片語）
use.eg: "Autumn" is used in British English and "fall" in American English.

use.eng_def: to take advantage of a person or situation; to exploit
use.eg: He's just using you - he'll steal your ideas and then take the credit for them himself.

use.eng_def: In negative sentences and questions, "use to" replaces "used to" when it follows "did" or "didn't"
use.chi_def: （在否定句和疑問句中，在 did 或 didn't 後 used to 變爲 use to）
use.eg: Did he use to be the doctor in "Star Trek"?

use.eng_def: a purpose for which something is used
use.eg: A food processor has a variety of uses in the kitchen.

use.eng_def: the act of using something, or a period of time when something is being used or can be used
use.eg: You should be able to put your experience in electronics to (good) use in your new job.

use.eng_def: to use something that is available
use.eg: We might as well make use of the hotel's facilities.

use.eng_def: permission to use something, or the ability to use something
use.chi_def: 使用…的許可；使用…的能力
use.eg: They said we could have the use of their beach house whenever they weren't there.

use.eng_def: the process of reducing the amount of something by burning it, eating it, involving it in a chemical reaction, etc.
use.eg: In anaerobic respiration, sugar is broken down to lactic acid without the use of oxygen.

use.eng_def: one of the meanings of a word, or the way that a particular word is used
use.chi_def: （某個詞的）意思之一；（某個詞的）用法之一
use.eg: Can you list all the uses of the word "point"?

used.eng_def: shows that a particular thing always happened or was true in the past, especially if it no longer happens or is no longer true
used.eg: She used to live in Glasgow.

used.eng_def: to be familiar with something or someone
used.eg: We're used to tourists here - we get thousands every year.

used.eng_def: to become familiar with something or someone
used.eg: Eventually you'll get used to the smells of the laboratory.

used.eng_def: that has already been put to the purpose it was intended for; not new
used.chi_def: 舊的；已經用過的；二手的

useful.eng_def: effective; helping you to do or achieve something
useful.chi_def: 有用的，有效的；有助益的
useful.eg: A good knife is probably one of the most useful things you can have in a kitchen.

user.eng_def: someone who uses a product, machine, or service
user.eg: Unemployed people are the main users of this advice centre.

usher.eng_def: to show someone where they should go, or to make someone go where you want them to go
usher.eg: She ushered us into her office and offered us coffee.

usher.eng_def: a man who shows people where they should sit, especially at a formal event such as a wedding or at a theatre or cinema
usher.chi_def: （尤指婚禮等正式場合或劇院、電影院的）引座員

usual.eng_def: normal; happening, done, or used most often
usual.eg: I went to bed at my usual time.

usual.eng_def: Someone's usual is the drink, especially an alcoholic one, that they most often have, for example when in a bar
usual.eg: A gin and tonic for my dad, and I'll have the/my usual.

utensil.eng_def: a tool with a particular use, especially in a kitchen or house
utensil.chi_def: （尤指廚房或家用的）器具，用具
utensil.eg: In the drawer was a selection of kitchen utensils - spoons, spatulas, knives, and whisks.

utility.eng_def: a service that is used by the public, such as an electricity or gas supply or a train service
utility.chi_def: 公用事業；（電、煤氣、鐵路等）公共設施

utility.eng_def: the usefulness of something, especially in a practical way

utilize.eng_def: to use something in an effective way
utilize.eg: The vitamins come in a form that is easily utilized by the body.

utmost.eng_def: used to emphasize how important or serious something is
utmost.eg: a matter of the utmost importance

utmost.eng_def: the greatest amount or degree possible
utmost.eg: The new model of the car offers the utmost in power and performance.

utter.eng_def: to say something or to make a sound with your voice
utter.eg: She sat through the whole meeting without uttering a word.

vacancy.eng_def: a space or place that is available to be used
vacancy.eg: We wanted to book a hotel room in July but there were no vacancies.

vacancy.eng_def: a job that no one is doing and is therefore available for someone new to do
vacancy.eg: There is a vacancy for a shop assistant on Saturdays.

vacant.eng_def: not filled or occupied; available to be used
vacant.eg: The hospital has no vacant beds.

vacant.eng_def: A vacant job is one that no one is doing and is therefore available for someone new to do
vacant.eg: The position fell (= became) vacant when Rodman was promoted.

vacant.eng_def: showing no interest or mental activity
vacant.chi_def: 無聊的；茫然的；沒精打采的
vacant.eg: She had a vacant look/expression on her face.

vacation.eng_def: a time when someone does not go to work or school but is free to do what they want, such as travel or relax
vacation.eg: We're taking a vacation in June.

vacation.eng_def: a period of the year when schools or colleges are closed, or when law courts do not operate

vaccine.eng_def: a substance that is put into the body of a person or animal to protect them from a disease by causing them to produce antibodies (=proteins that fight diseases)
vaccine.eg: This vaccine protects against some kinds of the bacteria.

vacuum.eng_def: a space from which most or all of the matter has been removed, or where there is little or no matter

vacuum.eg: The withdrawal of troops from the area has created a security vacuum which will need to be filled.

vacuum.eng_def: kept separate from other people and activities
vacuum.eg: No artist works in a vacuum - we are all of us influenced by others.

vacuum.chi_def: 真空吸塵器（同 vacuum cleaner）

vacuum.eng_def: to use a vacuum cleaner to collect dust, dirt, etc.
vacuum.eg: Vacuum (up) the cake crumbs, would you?

vague.eng_def: not clearly expressed, known, described, or decided
vague.eg: I do have a vague memory of meeting her many years ago.

vague.eng_def: not clear in shape, or not clearly seen
vague.eg: Through the mist I could just make out a vague figure.

vague.eng_def: A vague person is not able to think clearly, or gives an impression of not thinking clearly in order to hide their real thoughts.
vague.eg: My aunt is incredibly vague - she can never remember where she puts things.

vain.eg: The doctors gave him more powerful drugs in the vain hope that he might recover.
I tried in vain to start a conversation.

vain.eng_def: too interested in your own appearance or achievements
vain.eg: He was very vain about his hair and his clothes.

valiant.eng_def: very brave or bravely determined, especially when things are difficult or the situation gives no cause for hope
valiant.eg: The company has made a valiant effort/attempt in the last two years to make itself more efficient.

valid.eng_def: based on truth or reason; able to be accepted
valid.chi_def: 確鑿的；合理的；有根據的；讓人信服的

valid.eng_def: A ticket or other document is valid if it is based on or used according to a set of official conditions that often include a time limit
valid.chi_def: （票或其他檔）有效的，正式認可的
valid.eg: My passport is valid for another two years.

valid.chi_def: 有法律效力的，有法律約束力的

valley.eng_def: an area of low land between hills or mountains, often with a river running through it

valuable.eng_def: Valuable information, advice, etc. is very helpful or important
valuable.chi_def: 有用的；重要的；有價值的
valuable.eg: He was able to provide the police with some valuable information.

value.eng_def: the amount of money that can be received for something
value.eg: She had already sold everything of value that she possessed.

value.eng_def: the importance or worth of something for someone
value.eg: For them, the house's main value lay in its quiet country location.

value.eng_def: how useful or important something is
value.eg: The photographs are of immense historical value.

value.eng_def: the beliefs people have, especially about what is right and wrong and what is most important in life, that control their behaviour
to give a judgment about how much money something might be sold for

van.eng_def: a medium-sized road vehicle, used especially for carrying goods, that often has no windows in the sides at the back
a medium-sized vehicle with windows all round , used for carrying more people than an ordinary car
at the front, or in the most advanced position, of something
van.chi_def: 在…方面領先，處在…的前沿
van.eg: The US is in the van of the quest to establish contact with other planets.

vanilla.eng_def: a substance made from the seeds of a tropical plant, used to give flavour to sweet foods
vanilla.chi_def: （用於給食物調味的）香子蘭精，香草精

vanilla.eng_def: used to describe a product or service that is basic and has no special features
vanilla.eg: I just want a vanilla bank account with low charges.

vanish.eng_def: to disappear or stop being present or existing, especially in a sudden, surprising way
vanish.eg: The child vanished while on her way home from school.

vanity.eng_def: the fact that you are too interested in your appearance or achievements
vanity.eg: He wants the job purely for reasons of vanity and ambition.

vanity.eng_def: a piece of bedroom furniture like a table with a mirror and drawers
a small cupboard that stands on the floor in a bathroom and has a washbasin (= a fixed bowl-shaped container for water) in the top
vanity.chi_def: （帶有盥洗盆的）浴室櫃；組合式盥洗盆

vapor.eng_def: gas or extremely small drops of liquid that result from the heating of a liquid or solid
vapor.eg: The hollow glass tank contains hot mercury vapour.

vapor.eng_def: a condition in which someone suddenly feels ill and weak, usually because of a shock

variable.eng_def: a number, amount, or situation that can change
variable.eg: The variables in the equation are X, Y, and Z.

variation.eng_def: a change in amount or level
variation.eg: Unemployment rates among white-collar workers show much less regional variation than corresponding rates among blue-collar workers.

variation.eng_def: something that is slightly different from the usual form or arrangement
variation.chi_def: 變種，變體；變化了的東西
variation.eg: There are wide variations in the way pensioners have benefited from the system.

variation.eng_def: one of several short tunes that are based on the same simple tune, but are different from it and from the others

variety.eng_def: the characteristic of often changing and being different
variety.eg: When planning meals, you need to think about variety and taste as well as nutritional value.
The article was about the different varieties of Spanish spoken in South America.

variety.eng_def: many different types of things or people
variety.eg: She does a variety of fitness activities.

variety.eng_def: a type of entertainment which includes several separate short performances, such as singing, dancing, magic tricks, and telling jokes

various.chi_def: 各種不同的；各種各樣的
various.eg: We had various problems on our journey, including a flat tyre.

vary.eng_def: If things of the same type vary, they are different from each other, and if you vary them, you cause them to be different from each other.
vary.eg: Salary scales vary between states/from state to state/according to state/with each state.

vary.eng_def: to change or cause something to change in amount or level, especially from one occasion to another
vary.eg: My taste in classical music varies greatly/widely, but I usually prefer Mozart or Brahms.

vase.eng_def: a container for holding flowers or for decoration

vast.eg: A vast audience watched the broadcast.

vegetable.eng_def: a plant, root, seed, or pod that is used as food, especially in dishes that are not sweet
a person who does not do anything or has no interest in doing anything
vegetable.chi_def: 懶散的人；對任何事都毫無興趣的人
vegetable.eg: Sitting at home all day in front of the TV slowly turned her into a vegetable.

vegetable.eng_def: a person who is unable to think or move correctly because of severe brain damage
made or obtained from a plant, or growing in the form of a plant

vegetarian.eng_def: a person who does not eat meat for health or religious reasons or because they want to avoid being cruel to animals
vegetarian.eg: Of the four million people who have become vegetarians in this country, nearly two thirds are women.

vegetarian.chi_def: 素食的；素的；不包括肉的

vegetation.eng_def: plants in general, or plants that are found in a particular area
vegetation.eg: The railway track will have to be cleared of vegetation if it is to be used again.

vehicle.eng_def: a machine, usually with wheels and an engine, used for transporting people or goods on land, especially on roads
vehicle.eg: A truck driver died last night when his vehicle overturned.

vehicle.eng_def: a way of achieving, producing, or expressing something
vehicle.chi_def: （實現、產生或表達…的）方法，手段，媒介
vehicle.eg: The conference was seen as an ideal vehicle for increased cooperation between the member states.

vehicle.eng_def: a show, film, exhibition, etc. that is used to show the special skills or qualities of one particular performer or artist
vehicle.chi_def: （為某個表演者或藝術家）特意製作的電影（或演出節目、展覽等）
vehicle.eg: The play seems to be little more than a vehicle for its director and star.

veil.eng_def: a piece of thin material worn by women to cover the face or head
veil.eg: After the ceremony, the bride lifted up her veil to kiss her husband.

veil.eng_def: A Christian woman who takes the veil becomes a nun.
A Muslim woman who takes or adopts the veil decides to wear traditional Muslim clothing.
veil.chi_def: 決定穿戴穆斯林女性的傳統服裝

veil.eng_def: a thin covering that hides something or stops you from seeing something clearly
veil.eg: The view over the lake was obscured by a veil of mist that hung in the air.

veil.eng_def: something that prevents you from knowing what is happening
veil.eg: We want to lift the veil of secrecy that surrounds government decisions.

veil.eng_def: to not talk any more about a subject because it could cause trouble or embarrassment
veil.eg: I think we should draw a veil over everything that happened at the party, don't you?
