veil.eng_def: to cover something, especially the face or body, with a veil
veil.chi_def: 用幕遮掩；（尤指）用面紗遮住
veil.eg: In some societies, women are expected to be veiled when they go out in public.

veil.eng_def: to hide or cover something so that you cannot see it clearly or understand it

vein.eng_def: a tube that carries blood to the heart from the other parts of the body
the frame of a leaf or an insect's wing
a narrow layer of a substance that forms in or fills a crack in rock
vein.eg: A rich vein of iron ore was found in the hillside.
A vein of satirical anger runs through all his work.

vein.eng_def: a style or a temporary mood
vein.eg: The opening scene is very violent, and the rest of the movie continues in (a) similar vein.

velvet.eng_def: a cloth usually made from silk or cotton with a thick, soft surface
velvet.eg: Her skin was as soft as velvet.

velvet.eng_def: Something that is velvety has a beautiful soft, smooth quality or appearance, usually something dark or deep.
velvet.chi_def: 柔軟光滑的；天鵝絨般的（通常為暗色的）

vendor.eg: For the past few months she's been working as a street vendor, selling fruit and vegetables.

venture.eng_def: a new activity, usually in business, that involves risk or uncertainty
venture.chi_def: （有風險的）企業；投機活動；商業冒險

venture.eng_def: to risk going somewhere or doing something that might be dangerous or unpleasant, or to risk saying something that might be criticized
venture.eg: She rarely ventured outside, except when she went to stock up on groceries.

verb.eng_def: a word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience
verb.eg: The words "run", "keep", and "feel" are all verbs.

verbal.eg: It can sometimes be difficult to give a verbal description of things like colours and sounds.

verge.eng_def: the edge or border of something
verge.eg: They set up camp on the verge of the desert.

verge.eng_def: the strip of land that borders a road or path
verge.eg: She left her car by the side of the road and walked along the grass verge to the emergency phone.

versatile.eng_def: able to change easily from one activity to another or able to be used for many different purposes
versatile.chi_def: 多種用途的；萬用的；多才多藝的
versatile.eg: He's a very versatile young actor who's as happy in highbrow dramas as he is in TV comedies.

verse.eng_def: writing that is arranged in short lines with a regular rhythm; poetry
one of the parts that a poem or song is divided into
verse.eg: Each verse was sung as a solo and then everyone joined in on the chorus.

verse.eng_def: one of the series of short parts that the writing of a holy book is divided into
verse.eg: She recited a verse from the Bible/the Koran.

version.eng_def: a particular form of something that is slightly different from other forms of the same thing
version.eg: The official version of events is that the police were attacked and were just trying to defend themselves.

versus.eng_def: used to say that one team or person is competing against another
versus.eg: Tomorrow's game is Newcastle versus Arsenal.

versus.eng_def: used when naming the two sides in a legal case
versus.eg: Abortion was legalized nationally in the United States following the Roe versus Wade case.

versus.eng_def: used to compare two things or ideas, especially when you have to choose between them

vertical.eng_def: standing or pointing straight up or at an angle of 90° to a horizontal surface or line
a vertical line, surface, or position
vertical.chi_def: 垂直線；垂直面；豎直位置
vertical.eg: In a two-stage operation, the steel structure will be raised to the vertical.

very.eng_def: (used to add emphasis to an adjective or adverb) to a great degree or extremely
very.chi_def: （用於強調形容詞或副詞）很，非常

very.eng_def: used to add force to a superlative adjective or to the adjectives "own" or "same"
very.chi_def: （用於強調形容詞最高級或 own，same 等形容詞）完全，最，正是
very.eg: This is the very best chocolate cake I've ever tasted.

very.eng_def: (used to add emphasis to a noun) exact or particular
very.chi_def: （用於強調名詞）同一的，恰好的，正是的
very.eg: This is the very book I've been looking for all month.

very.eng_def: used to describe or emphasize the furthest point of something
very.eg: He found the piece of paper he had lost at the very bottom of the pile.

vessel.eng_def: a large boat or a ship
a curved container that is used to hold liquid
vessel.eg: The remains of some Roman earthenware vessels were found during the dig.

vessel.eng_def: a person who has a particular quality or who is used for a particular purpose
vessel.eg: As a young and spirited politician, he seems a worthy vessel for the nation's hopes.

vessel.eng_def: a tube that carries liquids such as blood through the body
vessel.eg: A heart attack is caused by the blood vessels that supply the blood to the heart muscle getting blocked.

vest.eng_def: a type of underwear, often with no sleeves, that covers the upper part of the body, worn for extra warmth
vest.chi_def: （無袖保暖）內衣；（貼身穿的）背心

vest.eng_def: a shirt without sleeves, usually made out of cotton, that is worn in the summer or for sport
vest.eg: The cyclists were all dressed in tight lycra shorts and the official team team vest.

vest.eng_def: a piece of clothing that covers the upper body but not the arms and usually has buttons down the front, worn over a shirt
vest.chi_def: （無袖保暖）內衣；（貼身穿的）背心

vest.eng_def: a piece of clothing like a jacket without sleeves, that is worn over other clothes for warmth or protection
vest.chi_def: （穿在其他衣服之上起保暖作用的）背心，馬甲，防護背心
vest.eg: Wear something warm, like a fleece jacket or a down vest.

vet.eng_def: a person with a medical degree trained to take care of the health of animals
vet.eg: The farmer called the vet out to treat a sick cow.

vet.eng_def: the office where a vet works
vet.eg: The cat injured her paw, so I took her to the vet.

vet.eng_def: informal for  veteran  (= a person who has served in the armed forces)
vet.chi_def: 老兵，退伍軍人（veteran的非正式用法）

vet.eng_def: to examine something or someone carefully to make certain that they are acceptable or suitable
vet.eg: During the war, the government vetted all news reports before they were published.

veteran.eng_def: a person who has had a lot of experience of a particular activity
veteran.eg: a 20-year veteran of the New York Police Department

veteran.eng_def: someone who has been in the armed forces during a war
having been involved in a particular activity for a long time
veteran.eg: She's also a veteran campaigner for human rights.

veto.eng_def: an official power or right to refuse to accept or allow something
veto.eg: The president has the power of veto over any bill that comes across his desk.
In 1961, President De Gaulle vetoed Britain's entry into the Common Market.

via.eng_def: going through or stopping at a place on the way to another place
via.eg: The London-Addis flight goes via Rome.

via.eng_def: using a particular machine, system, or person to send or receive something
via.eg: Reports are coming in via satellite.

vibrate.eng_def: to shake slightly and quickly, or to cause something to do this, in a way that is felt rather than seen or heard
vibrate.eg: The whole station seemed to vibrate as the express train rushed through.

vibrate.eng_def: a setting on an electronic device that causes it to vibrate when something happens, such as receiving a new message
vibrate.eg: The show's about to start - I'm going to put my phone on vibrate.

vibration.eg: Vibrations were felt hundreds of miles from the centre of the earthquake.

vice.eng_def: used as part of the title of particular positions. The person who holds one of these positions is next below in authority to the person who holds the full position and can act for them
vice.eg: the vice captain of the team

vice.eng_def: a moral fault or weakness in someone's character
vice.chi_def: 墮落，邪惡；不良習氣，惡習
vice.eg: Greed, pride, envy, and lust are considered to be vices.

vice.eng_def: illegal and immoral activities, especially involving illegal sex, drugs, etc.
vice.chi_def: （尤指與性或毒品有關的）罪行，道德敗壞行為
vice.eg: The chief of police said that he was committed to wiping out vice in the city.

vice.eng_def: a tool with two parts that can be moved together by tightening a screw so that an object can be held firmly between them while it is being worked on
vice.eg: Vices are often used to hold pieces of wood that are being cut or smoothed.

vice-president.eng_def: the person who has the position immediately below the president in some countries, and who is responsible for the president's duties if he or she is unable to do them
the person who is responsible for a large, important part of a company or organization
vice-president.eg: She's vice president of sales and marketing.

vicious.eng_def: Vicious people or actions show an intention or wish to hurt someone or something very badly.
used to describe an object, condition, or remark that causes great physical or emotional pain
vicious.eg: a large collection of vicious medieval torture instruments

victim.eng_def: someone or something that has been hurt, damaged, or killed or has suffered, either because of the actions of someone or something else, or because of illness or chance
victim.chi_def: 受害者；罹難者；犧牲者；犧牲品
victim.eg: to provide financial aid to hurricane/flood, etc. victims

victim.eng_def: to be hurt, damaged, or killed because of something or someone
victim.chi_def: 成為…的受害者；被…所傷（或所害）
victim.eg: In 1948, Gandhi fell victim to a member of a Hindu gang.

victimize.eng_def: to treat someone in an intentionally unfair way, especially because of their race, sex, beliefs, etc.
victimize.chi_def: （尤指因種族、性別或信仰的原因）使受害，虐待，迫害
victimize.eg: He claimed he'd been victimized by the police.

victor.eng_def: the winner of a game, competition, election, war, etc.
victor.eg: The victor in/of the 1960 US presidential election was John F. Kennedy.

victorious.eng_def: having won a game, competition, election, war, etc.
victorious.eg: The victorious team were loudly cheered by their fans.

victory.eng_def: an occasion when you win a game, competition, election, war, etc. or the fact that you have won
victory.eg: The Redskins opened the season by scoring a resounding/stunning/impressive 25–3 victory against/over Detroit.

victory.eng_def: a run around a track or sports field that is made by a winner of a race or a team that has won a game
victory.chi_def: （贏得比賽勝利後的）繞場慶祝

video.eng_def: a recording of moving pictures and sound, especially as a digital file, DVD, etc.
video.eg: My new laptop handles video really well.

video.eng_def: a short film made to go with a popular song
video.eg: Have you seen the video for "Crazy in Love"?

video.eng_def: connected with or used in the showing of moving pictures by television
to record a programme from the television, or to use a video camera to film an event

videotape.eng_def: special magnetic tape used for recording moving pictures and sounds
videotape.eg: They had captured the whole thing on videotape.

videotape.eng_def: to record a film, television programme, or event on videotape

view.eng_def: an opinion, belief, or idea, or a way of thinking about something
view.eg: Do you have any views about/on what we should do now?

view.eng_def: a way of thinking about the world
view.eg: Our world view is quite different from that of writers in the fourth century BC.

view.eng_def: what you can see from a particular place, or the ability to see from a particular place
view.eg: The view from the top of the mountain is breathtaking/magnificent/spectacular.

view.eng_def: a picture of a particular place
view.eg: He paints rural views (= pictures of the countryside).
I always make sure I keep the children in view whenever we're in a public place.

view.eng_def: If something is on view, it is arranged so that it can be seen by the public.
view.eg: The plans for the new road will soon be on view to the public in the library.

view.eng_def: to have a particular opinion or way of thinking about someone or something
view.eg: A reporter asked the minister how he viewed recent events.
There's a special area at the airport where you can view aircraft taking off and landing.

view.eng_def: to look at something in a complete or careful way
view.eg: We have two people coming to view the house this afternoon.

viewer.eng_def: a person who watches something, especially television
viewer.eg: Millions of viewers will be glued to their sets for this match.

viewer.eng_def: a device for looking at slides (= photographs on small pieces of film)

vigor.eg: They set about their work with youthful vigour and enthusiasm.

vigor.eng_def: strength of thought, opinion, expression, etc.
vigor.eg: He gave his side of the story with vigour.

vigorous.chi_def: 充滿活力的；有力量的；精力旺盛的

vigorous.eg: Cutting the bush back in the autumn will help promote vigorous growth in the spring.

villa.eng_def: a house, usually in the countryside or near the sea, especially in southern Europe, and often one that people can rent for a holiday
villa.eg: They have a villa in Spain.

village.eng_def: a group of houses and other buildings that is smaller than a town, usually in the countryside
all the people who live in a village
village.eg: The village is/are campaigning for a by-pass to be built.

villain.eng_def: a bad person who harms other people or breaks the law

villain.eng_def: a character in a book, play, film, etc. who harms other people
villain.eg: He made his reputation as an actor playing villains.

villain.eng_def: something or someone considered harmful or dangerous
villain.eg: We've always been told that cholesterol was a major cause of heart disease but, actually, saturated fat is the worst villain.

vine.eng_def: the climbing plant that produces grapes as its fruit
any type of plant that climbs or grows along the ground and has twisting stems
vine.eg: Ivy is a type of vine.

vinegar.eng_def: a sharp-tasting liquid, made especially from sour wine, malt, or cider, that is used to add flavour to or to preserve food

vineyard.eng_def: a piece of land on which vines are grown

violate.eng_def: to break or act against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
violate.chi_def: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）

violate.eg: The fishermen claimed that ships from another country had violated their territorial waters.
She said that she had been treated so roughly by the hospital staff that she felt violated.

violation.eng_def: an action that breaks or acts against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
violation.chi_def: 違反，違背，違犯（尤指法律、協議、原則等）
violation.eg: He claimed that the way he'd been treated was a gross violation of his civil/constitutional/human rights.

violence.eng_def: actions or words that are intended to hurt people
violence.eg: It seems that the attack was a gratuitous/random/mindless act of violence.
We were all surprised at the violence of his anger/rage.

violent.eng_def: using force to hurt or attack
violent.eg: He yells a lot but I don't think he's ever been physically violent towards her.

violent.eng_def: used to describe a situation or event in which people are hurt or killed
A violent colour is extremely or unpleasantly bright.
violent.chi_def: （顏色）極其鮮艷的，明艷刺眼的
violent.eg: She was wearing a violent pink sweater and orange trousers.

violet.eng_def: a small plant with pleasant-smelling purple, blue, or white flowers

violin.eng_def: a wooden musical instrument with four strings that is held against the neck and played by moving a bow across the strings

violinist.eng_def: a person who plays a violin
violinist.chi_def: 小提琴演奏者；小提琴家

virgin.eng_def: someone who has never had sex
virgin.eg: She remained a virgin until she was over thirty.

virgin.eng_def: a person with no experience of a particular activity
virgin.chi_def: 從未有過…經歷的人；新手

virgin.eng_def: A virgin forest or area of land has not yet been cultivated (= used to grow crops) or used by people.
virgin.chi_def: （森林等）未開發的，原始狀態的

virgin.eng_def: Virgin oil, especially olive oil, is made directly from pressing the fruit, rather than by using heat.
virgin.chi_def: （油，尤指橄欖油）初榨的，直接提取的

virgin.eng_def: pure and not spoiled, especially when describing something white
virgin.chi_def: （尤指白色物品）純潔的，未玷污的
virgin.eg: a virgin sheet of paper (= one not written on)

virtual.eng_def: almost a particular thing or quality

virtual.eng_def: Something that is virtual can be done or seen using a computer and therefore without going anywhere or talking to anyone.

virtue.eng_def: a good moral quality in a person, or the general quality of being morally good

virtue.eg: Would there be any virtue in taking an earlier train?

virtue.eng_def: because of; as a result of
virtue.eg: She succeeded by virtue of her tenacity rather than her talent.

virus.eng_def: an extremely small piece of organic material that causes disease in humans, animals, and plants
a disease caused by a virus
virus.chi_def: 病毒病，病毒性疾病；病毒感染
virus.eg: I don't know exactly what's wrong with her - I think she has some kind of virus.

virus.eng_def: a computer program or part of a computer program that can make copies of itself and is intended to prevent the computer from working normally

visa.eng_def: an official mark, usually made in a passport, that allows you to enter or leave a particular country
visa.eg: We travelled to Argentina on a tourist visa.

visible.eg: You should wear something light-coloured when you're cycling at night so that you're more visible.

visible.eng_def: able or likely to attract public attention and be noticed

vision.eng_def: an idea or mental image of something
vision.eg: We see in his novels his sinister, almost apocalyptic, vision of the future.

vision.eng_def: an experience in which you see things that do not exist physically, when your mind is affected powerfully by something such as deep religious thought or drugs or mental illness
vision.eg: She had visions in which the angel Gabriel appeared to her.

vision.eng_def: the ability to imagine how a country, society, industry, etc. could develop in the future and to plan for this
vision.eg: He didn't have the mental agility or vision required for a senior politician.
She has very little vision in her left eye.

vision.eng_def: (used when referring to a person) a beautiful and impressive sight

visit.eng_def: to go to a place in order to look at it, or to a person in order to spend time with them
visit.eg: We visited a few galleries while we were in Prague.

visit.eng_def: to go to a website on the internet
an occasion when you visit a place or person
visit.eg: We had a visit from the school inspector last week.

visit.eng_def: to visit a person or place, usually for a short time
visit.eg: I think I'll pay a visit to the library while I'm in town.

visitor.eng_def: someone who visits a person or place
visitor.eg: You have some visitors to see you.

visitor.eng_def: someone who goes to a website on the internet

visualize.eng_def: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind, in order to imagine or remember him, her, or it
visualize.eg: I was so surprised when he turned up - I'd visualized someone much older.

vital.eng_def: necessary for the success or continued existence of something; extremely important
vital.chi_def: 必不可少的；極其重要的
vital.eg: A strong opposition is vital to a healthy democracy.

vital.chi_def: 生機勃勃的；充滿生氣的
vital.eg: He had never felt so vital and full of life.

vitality.eg: According to the packet, these vitamin pills will restore lost vitality.

vitamin.eng_def: any of a group of natural substances that are necessary in small amounts for the growth and good health of the body

vivid.eng_def: Vivid descriptions, memories, etc. produce very clear, powerful, and detailed images in the mind
vivid.chi_def: （描述、記憶等）栩栩如生的，鮮活的，生動的
vivid.eg: He gave a very vivid and often shocking account/description of his time in prison.
She was wearing a vivid pink shirt.

vocabulary.eng_def: all the words known and used by a particular person
vocabulary.chi_def: 詞彙量；（某人掌握的）全部詞彙

vocabulary.eng_def: all the words that exist in a particular language or subject
vocabulary.chi_def: （某一語言或學科的）詞彙，術語
vocabulary.eg: Every week our Spanish teacher gives us a list of vocabulary (= words) to learn.

vocal.eng_def: relating to or produced by the voice, either in singing or speaking
often expressing opinions and complaints in speech
vocal.chi_def: 喜歡暢所欲言的；直言不諱的
vocal.eg: He had always been a very vocal critic of the president.

vocal.eng_def: the singing in a piece of popular music
vocal.eg: The vocals are shared by two members of the band.

vocation.eng_def: a type of work that you feel you are suited to doing and to which you should give all your time and energy, or the feeling that a type of work suits you in this way
vocation.chi_def: （值得投入所有時間和精力的）職業，工作；（認為某種職業適合自己的）使命感
vocation.eg: I feel I've found/missed my true vocation.

vocational.eng_def: providing skills and education that prepare you for a job
vocational.eg: The Swedes regard vocational training as a part of a youngster's education.

vogue.eng_def: a fashion or general liking, especially one that is temporary
vogue.eg: In the 1920s, short hair for women became the vogue.

voice.eng_def: the sounds that are made when people speak or sing

voice.eg: The choir seems to be in good voice today!

voice.eng_def: (the right to) an expression of opinion
voice.chi_def: 意見的表達；發言權；表達意見的權利
voice.eg: There was only one dissenting voice during the discussion.

voice.eng_def: an important quality or opinion that someone expresses, or the person who is able to express it
voice.chi_def: 意見；觀點；願望；發表意見的人
voice.eg: She just won't listen to the voice of reason.

voice.eng_def: the relationship between the subject of the verb and the action described by the verb, or the forms of a verb that show this relationship
to say what you think about a particular subject, especially to express a doubt, complaint, etc. that you have about it
voice.chi_def: 表達；吐露；（尤指）表示（質疑、抱怨）
voice.eg: I have voiced my objections to the plan to management.

voice.eng_def: to produce a sound by making the vocal cords move very quickly several times

volcano.eng_def: a mountain with a large, circular hole at the top through which lava (= hot liquid rock) gases, steam, and dust are or have been forced out

volleyball.eng_def: a game in which two teams use their hands to hit a large ball backwards and forwards over a high net without allowing the ball to touch the ground

volume.eng_def: the amount of space that is contained within an object or solid shape
volume.eg: Which of these bottles do you think has the greater volume?

volume.eng_def: the number or amount of something in general
volume.eg: It's the sheer volume of traffic in the city that is causing the problems.

volume.eng_def: the level of sound produced by a television, radio, etc., or the switch or other device controlling this
volume.eg: Could you turn the volume down, please, I'm trying to sleep.

volume.eng_def: one in a set of related books
volume.eg: The second volume of his memoirs will be published later this year.
She took a slim volume down from the shelf.

voluntary.eng_def: done, made, or given willingly, without being forced or paid to do it
voluntary.eg: She does voluntary work for the Red Cross two days a week.

voluntary.eng_def: A voluntary organization is controlled and supported by people who give their time and money to it without being paid, and that exists to help other people.
voluntary.eg: The hospital has asked various voluntary organizations to help raise money for the new operating theatre.

volunteer.eng_def: a person who does something, especially helping other people, willingly and without being forced or paid to do it
volunteer.chi_def: 自願參加者，（尤指幫助別人的）志願者
volunteer.eg: The Health clinic is relying on volunteers to run the office and answer the phones.

volunteer.eng_def: to offer to do something that you do not have to do, often without having been asked to do it and/or without expecting payment
volunteer.chi_def: 自願做；無償做；作志願者；主動提出做
volunteer.eg: During the emergency many staff volunteered to work through the weekend.

volunteer.eng_def: to give information without being asked
volunteer.eg: If I were you, I wouldn't volunteer any details of what happened.

vomit.eng_def: to empty the contents of the stomach through the mouth
vomit.eg: He came home drunk and vomited all over the kitchen floor.

vote.eng_def: to express your choice or opinion, especially by officially writing a mark on a paper or by raising your hand or speaking in a meeting
vote.eg: She was too young to vote in the election.

vote.eng_def: the act of showing your choice or opinion in an election or meeting by writing an X on an official piece of paper or putting your hand up
vote.eg: The suggestion was approved, with 25 votes in favour, and seven against.

vote.eng_def: a way of making a decision by asking a group of people to vote
vote.eg: We called a meeting in order to take/hold a vote on the issue.

vote.eng_def: the total number of votes given or received in an election
vote.eg: The party got/took 25 percent of the vote.

vote.eng_def: the fact of being officially allowed to vote
vote.eg: In some countries women still don't have the vote.
The proposal was read out and then put to the vote.

voter.eng_def: a person who votes or who has a legal right to vote, especially in an election
voter.chi_def: 投票人；表決者；（尤指）選民
voter.eg: Of course, tax cuts are usually popular with (the) voters.

vow.eng_def: to make a determined decision or promise to do something
vow.eg: The guerrillas vowed (that) they would overthrow the government.
She took/made a vow never to lend money to anyone again.

vowel.eng_def: a speech sound produced by humans when the breath flows out through the mouth without being blocked by the teeth, tongue, or lips
vowel.eg: A short vowel is a short sound as in the word "cup".

vowel.eng_def: a letter that represents a sound produced in this way
vowel.eg: The vowels in English are a, e, i, o, and u.

voyage.eng_def: a long journey, especially by ship
voyage.eg: He was a young sailor on his first sea voyage.
In their little boat they planned to voyage to distant lands.

vulgar.eng_def: not suitable, simple, dignified or beautiful; not in the style preferred by the upper classes of society
rude and likely to upset or anger people, especially by referring to sex and the body in an unpleasant way
vulgar.eg: It was an extremely vulgar joke.

vulnerable.eng_def: able to be easily physically, emotionally, or mentally hurt, influenced, or attacked
vulnerable.chi_def: 易受傷的；易受影響（或攻擊）的；脆弱的
vulnerable.eg: I felt very vulnerable, standing there without any clothes on.

wade.eng_def: to walk through water or other liquid with some effort, because it is deep enough to come quite high up your legs, or thick
wade.eg: The river was full but we managed to wade across.

wade.eng_def: to walk in water that is not very deep
wade.eg: We rolled up our trousers and waded at the edge of the lake.

wag.eng_def: (especially of a tail or finger) to move from side to side or up and down, especially quickly and repeatedly, or to cause this to happen
wag.eg: The little dog's tail wagged in delight.

wag.eng_def: (especially of a tail or finger) a movement from side to side or up and down
wag.chi_def: （尤指尾巴或手指的）擺動，搖動
wag.eg: With a single wag of her finger she managed to convey her total disapproval.

wag.eng_def: a humorous person who likes to make jokes
wag.chi_def: 幽默的人；愛開玩笑的人
（尤指足球運動員的太太或女友組成的）老婆俱樂部成員，太太團成員

wag.eng_def: informal abbreviation for wife and girlfriend: a woman who is a wife or girlfriend, especially of a well-known sports player
wag.chi_def: （尤指足球運動員的太太或女友組成的）老婆俱樂部，太太團（wife and girlfriend的縮寫）

wage.eng_def: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education
wage.chi_def: （尤指支付給體力勞動者並通常按週計算的）工資，工錢，報酬

wage.eng_def: to fight a war or organize a series of activities in order to achieve something
wage.chi_def: 發動（戰爭）；組織，籌備（活動）
wage.eg: Doesn't the president need Congress' permission to wage war on another country?

wages.eng_def: a particular amount of money that is paid, usually every week, to an employee, especially one who does work that needs physical skills or strength, rather than a job needing a college education
wages.chi_def: （尤指支付給體力勞動者並通常按週計算的）工資，工錢，報酬

wages.eng_def: to fight a war or organize a series of activities in order to achieve something
wages.chi_def: 發動（戰爭）；組織，籌備（活動）
wages.eg: Doesn't the president need Congress' permission to wage war on another country?

wagon.eng_def: a vehicle with four wheels, usually pulled by horses or oxen, used for transporting heavy goods, especially in the past
wagon.eg: The first white settlers journeyed across America in covered wagons.

wagon.eng_def: a small vehicle like a box on four wheels, which has a long handle to pull it along, and is used by children as a toy
wagon.eg: He pulled his brother along in his little red wagon.

wagon.eng_def: a large wheeled container for transporting goods, that is pulled by a train

wail.eng_def: to make a long, high cry, usually because of pain or sadness
wail.eg: The women gathered around the coffin and began to wail, as was the custom in the region.
Business people wailed that their trade would be ruined.

wail.eng_def: a long, high, loud cry, especially because of something unpleasant

waist.eng_def: the part of the body above and slightly narrower than the hips
the part of a piece of clothing that goes around or covers the area between the hips and the ribs
waist.eg: The skirt had an elasticated waist.

wait.eng_def: to allow time to go by, especially while staying in one place without doing very much, until someone comes, until something that you are expecting happens or until you can do something
wait.eg: I waited for her outside while she went in to see the doctor.

wait.eng_def: to be done or to happen at a later time
wait.eg: The meeting will have to wait until tomorrow, because I'm too busy now.

wait.eng_def: used on signs to mean vehicles are not allowed to park, even for short periods of time
wait.eg: The sign by the side of the road said "no waiting!"

wait.eng_def: a period of time when you stay in one place until someone comes, or something happens, or until you can do something
wait.eg: We had a three-hour wait before we could see the doctor.

waiter.eng_def: a man whose job is to bring the food to customers at their tables in a restaurant

waitress.eng_def: a woman whose job is to bring the food to customers at their tables in a restaurant

wake.eng_def: to (cause someone to) become awake and conscious after sleeping
wake.eg: Did you wake at all during the night?

wake.eng_def: the waves that a moving ship or object leaves behind
wake.chi_def: （航行的船隻等留下的）尾流，航跡
wake.eg: The wake spread out in a v-shape behind the ship.

wake.eng_def: an occasion when the family and friends of a dead person meet in order to look at the dead body the night before it is buried, or when they meet after a dead person has been buried to drink and talk about the person's life

waken.eg: I shook him but he didn't waken.

walk.eng_def: to move along by putting one foot in front of the other, allowing each foot to touch the ground before lifting the next
to go with someone to a particular place, for example because you want to protect them from danger, or show them the way
walk.eg: He offered to walk her home/to the station.

walk.eng_def: to take an animal, especially a dog, for a walk
walk.eg: She walks the dog for an hour every afternoon.

walk.eng_def: someone who seems to be a human form of disaster, encyclopedia, etc.
walk.chi_def: 活災難（指帶來災難的人）／活百科全書（等等）
walk.eg: You broke another pair of glasses? You're just a walking disaster!

walk.eng_def: to be allowed to leave a court after being found not guilty of a crime
walk.eg: If police don't get the right evidence, he'll walk.

walk.eng_def: in baseball, to receive four balls outside the hitting area and be allowed to go to first base, or to throw the ball outside the hitting area four times so that the batter is allowed to go to first base
walk.chi_def: （棒球打擊手因投手投出四個壞球而）自由上壘
walk.eg: The first batters either missed or walked.

walk.eng_def: to pass or win something, such as an exam or game, easily
walk.chi_def: 輕鬆通過（考試）；輕鬆取得（比賽）的勝利
walk.eg: She'll walk the interview - the job is practically hers already.

walk.eng_def: a journey that you make by walking, often for enjoyment
walk.eg: He went for/took a walk around the block, to get some air.

walk.eng_def: a path or route where people can walk for enjoyment
walk.eg: Do you know any nice walks around here?
He has a strange waddling sort of walk.
She slowed the horses to a walk.

walk.eng_def: a journey that takes a short time, five minutes, ten minutes, etc. when you walk
walk.chi_def: 步行很短／五分鐘／十分鐘（等等）的一段路
walk.eg: The school is only a five-minute walk away.

walk.eng_def: in baseball, an occasion when a batter is allowed to go to first base after the pitcher has thrown the ball outside the hitting area four times
walk.chi_def: （棒球打擊手因投手投出四個壞球而）自由上壘

wall.eng_def: a vertical structure, often made of stone or brick, that divides or surrounds something
wall.eg: The walls in this apartment are so thin you can hear just about every word the neighbours say.

wall.eng_def: any outer part of a hollow structure in the body
a mass of people or things formed in such a way that you cannot get through or past them
wall.eg: The demonstrators formed a solid wall to stop the police from getting past them.

wall.eng_def: in football, a row of players who stand ten yards away from where a free kick is taken in order to make scoring directly from the free kick more difficult
wall.chi_def: （足球比賽期間罰任意球前對方球員組成的）人牆
wall.eg: Rooney curved the free kick past the Newcastle defensive wall and inside the far post.

wall.eng_def: a large, powerful, usually fast moving mass of something
wall.eg: After the rains, the houses were washed away by a wall of mud/water.

wall.eng_def: a way of feeling or behaving that completely prevents two groups of people from communicating with or understanding each other
wall.eg: There is a wall of mistrust between the two groups.

wallet.eng_def: a small folding case for carrying paper money, credit cards and other flat objects, that can be carried in a pocket and is used especially by men
wallet.eg: He pulled out a big, fat wallet stuffed with bank notes.

wallet.eng_def: a small container for carrying coins, paper money, and credit cards, used especially by women
a flat, folding bag that is used for holding documents, for example passports

walnut.eng_def: a nut with a slightly bitter taste and a series of folds in it and a hard shell, or (the expensive, light brown wood from) the tree that produces these nuts
walnut.chi_def: 胡桃，核桃；胡桃樹，核桃樹；胡桃木，核桃木

wander.eng_def: to walk around slowly in a relaxed way or without any clear purpose or direction
wander.eg: We spent the morning wandering around the old part of the city.

wander.eng_def: to start talking about a different subject from the one you were originally discussing
wander.eg: We've wandered off/from the point somewhat.

wander.eng_def: If your mind or your thoughts wander, you stop thinking about the subject that you should be giving your attention to and start thinking about other matters.
wander.eg: Halfway through the meeting my mind started to wander.

wander.eng_def: If you say that an old person's mind is beginning to wander, you mean that they are starting to get very confused because of their age.
wander.chi_def: （因年老而）神志恍惚，精神錯亂
wander.eg: Her mind is beginning to wander and she doesn't always know who I am.

want.eng_def: to wish for a particular thing or plan of action. "Want" is not used in polite requests
want.chi_def: 想要，希望（英國英語中禮貌的請求不用 want）

want.eng_def: to wish or need someone to be present
want.eg: Am I wanted at the meeting tomorrow?

want.eng_def: to want to start or stop being involved in something
want.eg: I want out of the whole venture before it's too late.
Do you think this soup wants a bit of salt?

want.eng_def: used in giving advice to mean that someone should do something
want.eg: She wants to tell him now, before it's too late.
For want of anything better to do I watched television for a while.
He appeared tired and in want of a shave.

war.eng_def: armed fighting between two or more countries or groups, or a particular example of this
a war that is fought over a long period and only ends when one side has neither the soldiers and equipment nor the determination left to continue fighting
a situation, often before a competition or battle, in which each opposing side attempts to frighten or discourage the other by making threats or by showing how strong it is
any situation in which there is strong competition between opposing sides or a great fight against something harmful
war.eg: The past few months have witnessed a price war between leading supermarkets.

ward.eng_def: one of the parts or large rooms into which a hospital is divided, usually with beds for patients
one of the parts into which a prison is divided
(in many countries) one of the areas into which a city or town is divided, having its own elected political representative or its own organizations for managing services
a person, especially a child, who is legally put under the protection of a law court or a guardian
ward.eg: The girl was made a ward of court to stop her father taking her out of the country.

ward.eng_def: towards the stated place or direction

wardrobe.eng_def: a tall cupboard in which you hang your clothes
wardrobe.eg: He hung his suit in the wardrobe.

wardrobe.eng_def: all of the clothes that a person owns
wardrobe.eg: I need a new summer wardrobe (= new clothes for summer).

wardrobe.eng_def: a department in a theatre, film company, etc. that is in charge of the clothes that the actors wear on stage, making certain that they are clean, repairing them and sometimes making them
wardrobe.chi_def: （劇院等的）服裝保管部，戲服部
wardrobe.eg: He's in charge of wardrobe at the local amateur theatre.

ware.eng_def: pottery (= objects made out of clay) of a particular type or make
used, often in shops, to refer to objects of the same material or type, especially things used in cooking and serving food
ware.chi_def: （常用於商店中表示用於烹飪或餐飲的）…製品，…用具

warehouse.eng_def: a large building for storing things before they are sold, used, or sent out to shops, or
warehouse.eg: The goods have been sitting in a warehouse for months because a strike has prevented distribution.

warehouse.eng_def: a large shop selling large numbers of a particular product at a cheap rate
warehouse.chi_def: 倉庫批發店，大型零售商店
warehouse.eg: We bought both sofas from a big furniture warehouse out of town.

warfare.eng_def: the activity of fighting a war, often including the weapons and methods that are used

warm.eng_def: having or producing a comfortably high temperature, although not hot
warm.eg: Are you warm enough or do you want me to put the heating on?

warm.eng_def: Warm clothes and covers are made of a material that keeps you warm.
warm.eg: I don't have a warm winter coat.

warm.eng_def: A warm colour is one that is based on or contains a colour such as red, yellow, or orange that suggests warmth.

warm.eg: It's cold standing out there - come into the warm.

warm.chi_def: 親切友好的；熱心的，熱情的

warm.eng_def: (especially in children's games) almost guessing a correct answer or discovering a hidden object
warm.chi_def: （尤指在兒童遊戲中）即將猜中的，快要發現的

warm.eng_def: to (cause to) become warm (= less cold)
warm.eg: You're so cold - come and warm your hands by the fire.

warming.eng_def: A warming type of food or drink makes you feel warm.
warming.chi_def: （食物或飲料）暖乎乎的，溫熱的
warming.eg: Have a nice warming bowl of soup.

warmth.eng_def: a high temperature that is comfortable but not hot
warmth.eg: I've put a T-shirt on under my sweater for extra warmth.

warmth.eng_def: a friendly and enthusiastic quality in someone or something
warmth.eg: I still remember the warmth of their welcome.

warn.eng_def: to make someone realize a possible danger or problem, especially one in the future
warn.eg: We were warned not to eat the fish which might upset our stomachs.

warranty.eng_def: a written promise from a company to repair or replace a product that develops a fault within a particular period of time, or to do a piece of work again if it is not satisfactory
warranty.eg: The warranty covers the car mechanically for a year, with unlimited mileage.

warrior.eng_def: a soldier, usually one who has both experience and skill in fighting, especially in the past

wary.eng_def: not completely trusting or certain about something or someone
wary.eg: I'm a little wary of/about giving people my address when I don't know them very well.

wash.eng_def: to clean yourself, or a part of yourself, with water and usually soap
wash.chi_def: （用水和肥皂）洗（身體的某部分）；洗澡
wash.eg: I'd like to wash before dinner.

wash.eng_def: If a particular material or piece of clothing washes well, it is not damaged or spoiled by repeated washing.
If water washes somewhere, it flows there, usually repeatedly.
wash.eg: She stood on the shore and let the water wash over her tired feet.

wash.eng_def: (of the sea) to carry something or someone to or away from a place
wash.eg: Overnight the waves had washed up a lot of rubbish.

wash.eng_def: the action of washing something or a part of your body
wash.eg: Those curtains need a good (= careful) wash.

wash.eng_def: all the clothes, sheets, etc. that are washed together, especially in a washing machine
wash.chi_def: （尤指用洗衣機一起洗的）所有衣物
wash.eg: Can I put this shirt in (with) the white wash?

wash.eng_def: to wash your body or a part of it
wash.chi_def: 洗一洗（身體某部分）；洗澡
wash.eg: I need to have a wash before dinner

wash.eng_def: to clean clothes, sheets, etc., usually in a washing machine
wash.eg: Are you doing a wash tonight?

wash.eng_def: a thin layer of water or paint mixed with water, especially one that is brushed lightly over a painting to make the lines softer
wash.eg: a blue wash/ a wash of blue

wash.eng_def: an event or situation in which positive and negative things balance each other
wash.eg: If pollution controls are enforced here, the factories will move to where they're allowed to pollute, so it'll be a wash as far as clear air goes.

wash.eng_def: (the sound made) when the sea moves against land, etc.
wash.eg: Outside the house, she could hear the gentle wash of the waves on the beach.

waste.eng_def: an unnecessary or wrong use of money, substances, time, energy, abilities, etc.
waste.eg: That meeting achieved absolutely nothing - it was a complete waste of time.

waste.eng_def: to not be used, eaten, etc.
waste.eg: You can even make stock from the bones, so that nothing goes to waste.

waste.eng_def: unwanted matter or material of any type, especially what is left after useful substances or parts have been removed
waste.eg: This city produces 20 million tons of household waste each year.

waste.eng_def: an area of ground in or near a city that is not built on or used in any way
waste.eg: His body had been dumped in an area of waste ground just outside the city.

waste.eng_def: large areas of land that are not used to grow crops and have few living animals or plants
waste.eg: the Arctic wastes of northern Siberia

waste.eng_def: to use too much of something or use something badly when there is a limited amount of it
waste.eg: You waste a lot of water by taking a bath instead of a shower.

watch.eng_def: to look at something for a period of time, especially something that is changing or moving
watch.eg: I had dinner and watched TV for a couple of hours.

watch.eng_def: to stay with someone or something, such as a child, for a short time to make certain that he, she, or it is safe
watch.eg: If you want me to watch the kids for a couple of hours while you go out, just let me know.
I have to watch my weight (= be careful not to become too heavy) now I'm not exercising so much.

watch.eng_def: a small clock that is worn on a strap around the wrist or, sometimes, connected to a piece of clothing by a chain
watch.eg: My watch seems to have stopped (= stopped working).

watch.eng_def: the activity of watching or giving attention to something or someone, especially to make certain nothing bad happens
watch.eg: The police keep a close watch on gang members.

watch.eng_def: a person or group of soldiers or guards whose duty is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack
watch.chi_def: 警衛；哨兵警衛隊；治安隊

watch.eng_def: a particular period of time during which a person or a group of soldiers or guards has the duty of protecting and warning of danger
watch.chi_def: 警戒時間；（警衛或治安隊等的）值班時間

water.eng_def: a clear liquid, without colour or taste, that falls from the sky as rain and is necessary for animal and plant life
an area of water, such as the sea, a lake, or a swimming pool
water.eg: The water's warm - are you coming in?

water.eng_def: the level of an area of water
water.eg: The river is difficult to cross during periods of high water.

water.eng_def: the area of sea near to and belonging to a particular country
water.eg: St Lucia depends on its clean coastal waters for its income.

water.eng_def: the water contained in a particular lake, river, or part of the sea
water.chi_def: （某一湖泊、河流或海洋的）水域
water.eg: In the shallow waters of the Gulf of Mexico, oil rigs attract fish.

water.eng_def: the liquid that surrounds a baby inside a pregnant woman's womb
water.eg: At 3 a.m. her waters broke, and the baby was born soon after.

water.eng_def: water from a spring, especially when used in the past for drinking or swimming in, in order to improve the health
water.eg: People used to come to this city to take (= drink or swim in) the waters.

water.eng_def: to pour water on to plants or the soil that they are growing in
water.eg: I've asked my neighbour to water the plants while I'm away.

water.eng_def: to give an animal water to drink
water.eg: The horses had been fed and watered.

water.eng_def: If your mouth waters, it produces a lot of saliva, usually because you can see or smell some food that you would like to eat.
water.eg: The smell of that bread is making my mouth water!

water.eng_def: When your eyes water, they produce tears but not because you are unhappy.
water.eg: How do you stop your eyes from watering when you're cutting up onions?

waterfall.eng_def: water, especially from a river or stream, dropping from a higher to a lower point, sometimes from a great height

watermelon.eng_def: a large, round or oval-shaped fruit with dark green skin, sweet pink flesh, and a lot of black seeds

waterproof.eng_def: not allowing water to go through
waterproof.eg: Canvas boots are all right but they're not as waterproof as leather.

waterproof.eng_def: to put a special substance on the surface of something that will prevent water from going through it
waterproof.chi_def: 使…不透水；對…作防水處理

waterproof.eng_def: a coat or other piece of clothing that keeps you dry because it does not allow water in

watertight.eng_def: having no openings to allow water to get in
watertight.chi_def: 防水的，水密的；不透水的
watertight.eg: They're doing some repairs to make the roof more watertight.

watertight.eng_def: (of a theory, plan, or agreement) formed very carefully in every detail so that nothing is uncertain or in doubt
watertight.chi_def: （理論、計劃或協議）嚴密的，無懈可擊的，毫無破綻的
watertight.eg: This book is designed to be provocative rather than a watertight piece of economic analysis.

watertight.eng_def: If a football team has a watertight defence, it stops an opponent from scoring a goal.
watertight.eg: Rovers' defence will need to be watertight in their Carling Cup clash with Watford.

wave.eng_def: to raise your hand and move it from side to side as a way of greeting someone, telling someone to do something, or adding emphasis to an expression
wave.chi_def: 揮（手）；招手，擺手（表示問候、指示或強調）
wave.eg: I waved to/at him from the window but he didn't see me.

wave.eng_def: to make a movement with your hand that tells someone to move in a particular direction
wave.chi_def: 揮手示意（某人）離開／繼續向前（等等）
wave.eg: You'll have to wait till the policeman waves the car on.

wave.eng_def: to move from side to side, or to make something move like this while holding it in the hand
wave.eg: The corn waved gently in the summer breeze.

wave.eng_def: If hair waves, it curls slightly.
wave.eg: If she leaves her hair to dry on its own, it just waves naturally.

wave.eng_def: a raised line of water that moves across the surface of an area of water, especially the sea
wave.eg: At night, I listened to the sound of the waves breaking/crashing against the shore.

wave.eng_def: the action of raising your hand and moving it from side to side as a way of greeting someone, etc.
a wave-like movement made by a crowd watching a sports game, when everyone stands and lifts up their arms and then sits down again one after another
wave.chi_def: 人浪（指體育比賽中觀眾依次舉起手臂站起後坐下，如波浪一般）

wave.eng_def: the pattern in which some types of energy, such as sound, light, and heat, are spread or carried
a larger than usual number of events of a similar, often bad, type, happening within the same period
an activity that is happening again or is being repeated after a pause
wave.eg: A new wave of job losses is expected this year.

wave.eng_def: A wave of an emotion or feeling is a sudden strong feeling that gets stronger as it spreads.
wave.eg: A wave of panic swept through the crowd.

wave.eng_def: a series of slight curves in a person's hair
wave.eg: Your hair has a natural wave, but mine's just straight.

wax.eng_def: a solid substance containing a lot of fat that becomes soft and melts when warm
wax.eg: She watched the wax as it dripped down the side of the candle.

wax.eng_def: the soft, yellowish substance inside your ears
to put a thin layer of wax on the surface of something, either to make it waterproof or to improve its appearance
wax.eg: I've waxed the floor so it's rather slippery.

wax.eng_def: to remove hair from someone's body by covering it in a thin layer of warm wax that is then pulled off
When the moon waxes, it gradually appears larger and rounder each day.
to speak or write in the stated way
wax.chi_def: 熱情洋溢／滔滔不絕地說（或寫）（等等）
wax.eg: My mother always used to wax lyrical about the lemon trees in her family's garden.

way.eg: Do you know the way to the restaurant?

way.eng_def: to travel or move to a place
way.eg: We slowly made our way down the river.

way.eng_def: used to talk about the direction in which something is facing

way.chi_def: 相反地，倒過來，以相反方式
way.eg: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way round.

way.chi_def: 相反地，倒過來，以相反方式
way.eg: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way around.

way.eng_def: used in the names of some roads
way.eg: Our offices are at 17 King's Way.

way.eng_def: a distance or a period of time
way.eg: We walked a long way yesterday.

way.eng_def: a particular choice, opinion, belief, or action, especially from among several possibilities
way.eg: I like the way you've done your hair.

way.eng_def: the manner in which someone behaves or thinks, or in which something happens
way.chi_def: （思維）風格；（行事）作風；（某事發生的）方式
way.eg: Don't worry - it's just his way.
Over the years we've got used to his funny little ways.

way.eng_def: an action that can produce the result you want; a method
way.eg: There are many ways of solving the problem.

way.eng_def: the space needed for a particular movement or action
way.eg: "Sorry, am I in your way? I'll move."

way.eng_def: If someone gets or has their way, what they want happens.
way.eg: If she doesn't get/have her (own) way, she sulks like a four-year-old.

way.eng_def: the bad condition or state of someone or something, especially the state of a person's health
way.eg: He's been in a bad way (= very ill) ever since the operation.

way.eng_def: used to emphasize degree or separation, especially in space or time
way.chi_def: 過度，大幅（尤其用於強調時間或空間中的程度或距離）
way.eg: After the third lap, she was way behind the other runners.
I think they live Birmingham way.

weak.eg: It's not surprising you feel weak if you haven't eaten properly for days.

weak.eng_def: not strong in character, so that you are not able to make decisions or to persuade or lead other people
weak.chi_def: 意志薄弱的；怯懦的，無決斷力的
weak.eg: He was a weak king surrounded by corrupt advisers.

weak.eng_def: A weak argument or excuse is one that is not likely to be accepted or believed.
weak.chi_def: （論據等）不充分的，無說服力的
weak.eg: Any evidence that exists to support the hypothesis is fairly weak.

weak.eng_def: A weak drink contains a lot of water compared to its other contents, so that it does not have a strong flavour.
A weak acid, alkali, or chemical base does not produce many ions (= atoms with an electrical charge) when it is dissolved in water.
weak.chi_def: （酸或堿）弱電解的，弱電解質的

weak.eng_def: not good enough, especially in ability, skill, or quality
weak.chi_def: 不符合標準的；不夠好的；能力不夠的
weak.eg: He was always weak at/in languages but strong in science.

weak.eng_def: A weak chin is small and does not stick out from the face.

weaken.eng_def: to (cause to) become less strong, powerful, determined, or effective
weaken.eg: You could see the poor dog weakening daily as the disease spread through its body.

wealth.eng_def: a large amount of money or valuable possessions that someone has
wealth.eg: During a successful business career, she accumulated a great amount of wealth.

wealth.eng_def: a large amount of something good
wealth.eg: Jim has a wealth of teaching experience.

weapon.eng_def: any object used in fighting or war, such as a gun, bomb, knife, etc.

wear.eng_def: to have clothing, jewellery, etc. on your body
wear.eg: Tracey is wearing a simple black dress.

wear.eng_def: to show a particular emotion on your face
wear.eg: The politician wore a confident smile throughout the interview.

wear.eng_def: to arrange your hair in a particular way
wear.eg: When she's working she wears her hair in a ponytail.

wear.eng_def: to become weaker, damaged, or thinner because of continuous use
wear.eg: I really like this shirt but it's starting to wear at the collar.

wear.eng_def: to produce something such as a hole or loss of material by continuous use, rubbing, or movement
wear.eg: I always seem to wear a hole in the left elbow of my sweaters.
I'd ask my boss for some time off but I don't think she'd wear it.

wear.eng_def: clothes suitable for a particular use or clothes of a particular type
wear.chi_def: （有某種特定用途或某一類型的）衣服

wear.eng_def: the amount or type of use an object has had or can be expected to have, especially before showing damage
wear.eg: I've had a lot of wear out of these boots - I've had them for five years.

weary.eng_def: very tired, especially after working hard for a long time
weary.chi_def: （尤指長時間辛苦工作後）筋疲力盡的，極為疲倦的
weary.eg: I think he's a little weary after his long journey.

weary.eng_def: bored with something because you have experienced too much of it
weary.eg: I've been going out with the same people to the same places for years and I've just grown weary of it.
Children weary me with their constant questions and demands.

weary.eng_def: to start to feel that something or someone is boring
weary.eg: Some people never seem to weary of eating the same type of food every day.

weather.eng_def: the conditions in the air above the earth such as wind, rain, or temperature, especially at a particular time over a particular area
to deal successfully with a difficult situation or a problem
weather.eg: As a small new company they did well to weather the recession.

weather.eng_def: to change in colour or form over a period of time because of the effects of sun, wind, or other weather conditions
weather.chi_def: （使）因風吹日曬而褪色，（使）受到風雨侵蝕，（使）風化
weather.eg: Rock is weathered by the action of ice and changes in temperature.

weave.eng_def: to make cloth by repeatedly crossing a single thread through two sets of long threads on a loom (= special frame)
weave.eg: This type of wool is woven into fabric which will make jackets.

weave.eng_def: to twist long objects together, or to make something by doing this
weave.eg: We were shown how to roughly weave ferns and grass together to make a temporary shelter.

weave.eng_def: to form something from several different things or to combine several different things, in a complicated or skilled way
weave.chi_def: （透過糅合不同的事物）編寫；編造
weave.eg: The biography is woven from the many accounts which exist of things she did.

weave.eng_def: to go or make a path by moving quickly and changing direction often, especially to avoid hitting things
weave.chi_def: （尤指為避開障礙）迂迴行進，穿行
weave.eg: The boy weaved through/between/in and out of stationary traffic on a bicycle.

weave.eng_def: a person whose job is weaving cloth and other materials
the way in which cloth has been woven, for example with the threads pulled firmly together, or the pattern produced by this process
a piece of hair that is added to a person's own hair in order to make the hair thicker or longer
weave.chi_def: （使頭髮顯得厚密或更長的）織髮
weave.eg: To recreate Alexander the Great's mane of hair, the actor had blonde dye and a weave.

web.eng_def: a net used to catch insects, made by a spider from the sticky thread that its body produces
web.eg: We watched a spider spin a web between three tall grass stems.

web.eng_def: the skin connecting the toes of some birds and other animals living by or on water that helps them when swimming
the system of connected documents on the internet
web.eg: Jane's been surfing the Web all morning.

website.eng_def: a set of pages of information on the internet about a particular subject, published by a single person or organization
website.eg: For more information about other Cambridge publications and courses, visit our website at www.cambridge.org.

wed.eng_def: (used especially in newspapers) to marry someone
wed.eg: The couple eventually wed after an 18-year engagement.
We'd better be more careful in the future.
We'd be grateful for an answer.

wedding.eng_def: a marriage ceremony and any celebrations such as a meal or a party that follow it

weed.eng_def: any wild plant that grows in an unwanted place, especially in a garden or field where it prevents the cultivated plants from growing freely
someone who is thin and physically weak or who is weak in character
weed.eg: He looks like a real weed in those shorts.

weed.eng_def: to remove wild plants from a place where they are not wanted

week.eng_def: a period of seven days, especially either from Monday to Sunday or from Sunday to Saturday
week.chi_def: 星期，週（尤指從星期一到星期日或從星期日到星期六

week.eng_def: the five days from Monday to Friday, the usual working period for many people
week.chi_def: 工作週（星期一到星期五）
week.eg: We're usually too tired to go out much during the week.

week.eng_def: one week after the day mentioned
week.eg: The first performance of the play is a week (from) today/tomorrow.

week.eng_def: one week before the day mentioned
week.eg: It was his birthday a week ago last Friday.

week.eng_def: the amount of hours spent working during a week or the number of days on which a person works
week.chi_def: 每週的工作時數；每週的工作日數
week.eg: A lot of farm workers work a six-day week.

week.eng_def: each week during a period of time
week.eg: We could see his health deteriorate week by week.

week.eng_def: regularly or continuously for many weeks
week.chi_def: 一週又一週地；一連數週
week.eg: I go to aerobics three times a week, week in, week out.

weekday.eng_def: any day of the week except Sunday and Saturday
weekday.eg: On weekdays I'm usually in bed by ten o'clock.

weekend.eng_def: Saturday and Sunday, or Friday evening until Sunday night; the part of the week in which many people living in the West do not go to work
weekend.chi_def: 週末（週六和週日，有時也包括週五晚上）
weekend.eg: This/Next weekend we're going to see some friends.

weekend.eng_def: a trip or a visit at a weekend
weekend.eg: How much would a weekend for two in New York cost?

weekend.eng_def: on Saturday or Sunday, or on both Saturday and Sunday
weekend.eg: What did you do at the weekend?

weekend.eng_def: usually or often between Friday evening and Sunday night, or on Saturdays and Sundays

weekly.eng_def: happening once a week or every week
a newspaper or magazine that is published once every week

weep.eg: People in the street wept with joy when peace was announced.

weep.eng_def: (of an injury) to produce liquid such as pus
weep.eg: The sore is still weeping a lot so you'll have to change the dressing once a day.

weigh.eng_def: to have a heaviness of a stated amount, or to measure the heaviness of an object
weigh.eg: Yesterday a satellite weighing 15 tons was successfully placed in orbit.

weigh.eng_def: (of something such as a fact or an event) to have an influence or be important
weigh.eg: Easy access to a skilled workforce weighed heavily with us when we chose a site for the new factory.

weigh.eng_def: to carefully consider, especially by comparing facts or possibilities, in order to make a decision
weigh.eg: Only when we have weighed all the factors involved can we decide when would be the best time to start.

weigh.eng_def: to lift the anchor (= a heavy metal object) of a ship from under the water so that it can move freely

weight.eng_def: the amount that something or someone weighs
weight.eg: What weight can this lorry safely carry?

weight.eng_def: a piece of metal of known heaviness that can be used to measure the heaviness of other objects

weight.eg: Try not to lift heavy weights.
Her experience does give her opinions quite a bit of weight.

weight.eng_def: to fasten something heavy to something
weight.eg: Paper tablecloths need to be weighted down or they blow away in the wind.

weird.eng_def: very strange and unusual, unexpected, or not natural
weird.chi_def: 怪異的；不尋常的；出乎意料的；超自然的
weird.eg: He was sitting alone by a window with a weird contraption on the table in front of him.

welcome.eng_def: to be pleased about and encourage or support something
welcome.chi_def: 樂於接受；歡迎；鼓勵；支持
welcome.eg: The new appointment has been widely welcomed.

welcome.eng_def: to meet and speak to someone in a friendly way when they arrive
welcome.eg: The visitors were warmly welcomed by the head of the department.

welcome.eng_def: If someone is welcome, you are pleased when they visit you.
welcome.eg: Come and see us whenever you're in town - you're always welcome/you'll always be welcome.

welcome.eng_def: to show someone that you are pleased that they are with you
welcome.eg: The restaurant makes children very welcome.

welcome.eng_def: If something is welcome, you are pleased to have or do it.
welcome.eg: The holiday was a welcome change/break/relief.

welcome.eng_def: used to tell someone that they can certainly do something
welcome.eg: Anyone who is interested is welcome to come along.

welcome.eng_def: the way in which someone is met and spoken to when they arrive in a place
welcome.eg: They were given a warm (= very friendly) welcome.

welcome.chi_def: 逗留得太久而不再受歡迎
welcome.eg: I left after two days - I didn't want to outstay my welcome.

welcome.eng_def: a reaction to a decision or suggestion
welcome.eg: Their supporters gave the decision a guarded/cautious welcome.

welcome.eng_def: said as a greeting to someone arriving at a place

welfare.eng_def: help given, especially by the state or an organization, to people who need it, especially because they do not have enough money
welfare.eg: Your taxes pay for welfare benefits such as unemployment and sickness pay.

welfare.eng_def: receiving financial help from the state because you are poor or have not been employed for a long time
welfare.chi_def: （因貧困或失業而）接受福利救濟

welfare.eng_def: physical and mental health and happiness, especially of a person
welfare.eg: The police are very concerned for the welfare of the missing child.

well.eng_def: in a good way, to a high or satisfactory standard
well.eg: The documentary presented both sides of the problem very well.

well.eng_def: very much, to a great degree, or completely
well.eg: Knead the dough well, then divide it into four pieces.
The results are well above/below what we expected.
The police are well aware of the situation.
She might well be the best person to ask.
Invite Emily - and Scott as well.
He hasn't been very well lately.

well.eng_def: used to introduce something you are going to say, often to show surprise, doubt, slight disagreement, or anger, or to continue a story
well.chi_def: （用於引出要說的話題，常用來表示驚訝、懷疑、不太同意或生氣，也用來繼續講故事）啊，哎呀，喲，那麼，好吧
well.eg: Well, what shall we do now?

well.eng_def: a deep hole in the ground from which you can get water, oil, or gas
(of liquid) to appear on the surface of something or come slowly out from somewhere
well.eg: Dirty water welled (up) out of the damaged pipe.
We'll do better next time, I'm sure.

west.eng_def: the direction in which the sun goes down in the evening, opposite to the east, or the part of an area or country that is in this direction
west.eg: The points of the compass are north, south, east, and west.
There has been concern in/throughout the West about the effects of this measure.

west.eng_def: In the US, the West is the part of the country west of the Mississippi river that only became developed in the late 1800s.
west.chi_def: （美國19世紀後期才開始發展的）西部

west.eng_def: to or in the west of the US
west.eg: Travis moved out west after college.

west.eng_def: in or forming the west part of something
a wind coming from the west

west.eg: Go due (= directly) west until you see a lake.

western.eng_def: in or from the west of a place
relating to countries in the west part of the world, especially North America and countries in the west of Europe
a film based on stories about life in the west of the US in the past
western.chi_def: （描寫過去美國西部生活的）西部片

wet.eng_def: covered in water or another liquid
Wet paint, ink, or a similar substance has not had time to dry and become hard.
used to describe weather or periods of time when rain falls
wet.eg: We've had wet weather all week.
Come in quickly - you're wet through.

wet.eng_def: used to describe someone who has a weak character and does not express any forceful opinions

wet.eg: Wet the powder thoroughly and mix to remove lumps.

wet.eng_def: to urinate in your clothes by accident
to urinate in your bed by accident
wet.eg: She still sometimes wets the bed at night.
Don't put your newspaper down in the wet.
Don't leave it out there in the wet.

wet.eng_def: someone who has a weak character and does not express any forceful opinions
wet.eg: Come on Tom, don't be such a wet!

wet.eng_def: a member of the Conservative Party in Britain with no strong or extreme opinions
wet.chi_def: 英國保守黨中觀點不夠鮮明（或激烈）的人

whale.eng_def: a very large sea mammal that breathes air through a hole at the top of its head

wharf.eng_def: an area like a wide wall built near the edge of the sea or a river where ships can be tied and goods can be taken off them
wharf.eg: The crates were unloaded onto the wharf.

what.eng_def: used to ask for information about people or things
used in questions that show you are surprised or do not believe something
what.chi_def: （用於疑問句中，表示驚奇或不相信）

what.eng_def: used to ask about the reason for something

what.chi_def: （作關係代詞引導從句）…那樣的；…的
what.eg: What I wanted to find out first was how long it was going to take.

what.eng_def: used to introduce something you are going to say
what.eg: You'll never guess what - Laurie won first prize!

what.eng_def: used to ask someone to say something again
what.eg: "I think we should leave at twelve." "What?" "I said I think we should leave at twelve."

whatever.eng_def: it is not important what is; it makes no difference what (is)

whatever.eg: I eat whatever I want and I still don't seem to put on weight.

whatever.eng_def: used instead of the word "what" to add emphasis to a phrase, usually expressing surprise
whatever.chi_def: （用於代替 what，加以強調以表示驚訝）到底甚麼，究竟是甚麼
whatever.eg: Whatever is he doing with that rod?

whatever.chi_def: （用於否定句後表強調）無論怎樣
whatever.eg: There is no evidence whatever to show that this is in fact the case.

whatever.eng_def: something that is said to show no respect to someone who is asking you to agree with them or agree to do something
whatever.chi_def: （用於有人強迫自己同意其觀點或做某事的的時候）怎樣都行，無所謂
whatever.eg: "Bryce, could you do what I ask you to once in a while?" "Whatever."

whatsoever.eng_def: used after a negative phrase to add emphasis to the idea that is being expressed
whatsoever.chi_def: （用於否定句後表強調）無論怎樣，絲毫，任何
whatsoever.eg: He has no respect for authority whatsoever.

wheat.eng_def: a plant whose yellowish-brown grain is used for making flour, or the grain itself

wheel.eng_def: a circular object connected at the centre to a bar, used for making vehicles or parts of machines move
wheel.eg: I got my bag caught in the wheel of my bicycle.

wheel.eng_def: Something that is on wheels has wheels under it so that it can be pulled or pushed along
wheel.eg: My suitcase is on wheels so that makes life a little easier.

wheel.eng_def: a steering wheel (= a wheel inside a vehicle that the driver turns to make the vehicle go in a particular direction)
wheel.eg: Keep your hands on the wheel!

wheel.eng_def: a wooden or metal wheel that is turned to make a ship go in a particular direction

wheel.eg: I've got to get some wheels - the buses are way too slow!

wheel.eng_def: to push an object that has wheels so that it moves in a particular direction
wheel.eg: I saw her last night wheeling a buggy along Green Lane.

wheel.eng_def: to fly repeatedly in a circular pattern
wheel.eg: She watched a flock of seagulls wheeling high above her.
She suddenly wheeled and looked directly at me.

wheelchair.eng_def: a chair on wheels that people who are unable to walk use for moving around
wheelchair.eg: He spent the last ten years of his life in a wheelchair after a fall that left him paralysed from the waist down.

when.eng_def: at what time; at the time at which
when.eg: "I did tell you about it." "When? I don't remember."
"Did you know Lucy was back in England?" "Is she - since when?"
How can you say you don't like something when you've never even tried it!
He says he doesn't have any money when in fact he has thousands of dollars in his account.

whenever.eg: I blush whenever I think about it.

whenever.eng_def: used instead of "when" to add emphasis to a phrase, usually expressing surprise
whenever.chi_def: 究竟甚麼時候，到底甚麼時候（用於代替 when 以加強語氣，表示驚訝）
whenever.eg: Whenever do you get the time to do these things?

where.eng_def: to, at, or in what place
used when referring to a particular stage in a process or activity
where.chi_def: 處於某種階段；到了某種地步
where.eg: You reach a point in any project where you just want to get the thing finished.
You're not available on the 12th and Andrew can't make the 20th - so where does that leave us?

whereabouts.eng_def: the place where a person or thing is
whereabouts.chi_def: （某人或某物的）行蹤，下落，去向
whereabouts.eg: Trupin is thought to be in the Caribbean, although his exact whereabouts are/is a mystery.
Whereabouts in Madrid do you live?

whereas.eng_def: compared with the fact that; but
whereas.eg: He must be about 60, whereas his wife looks about 30.

wherever.eng_def: to or in any or every place
wherever.chi_def: 無論到（或在）哪裡；無論甚麼地方
wherever.eg: We can go wherever you like.
Wherever possible I use honey instead of sugar.

wherever.eng_def: used instead of "where" to add emphasis to a phrase, usually expressing surprise
wherever.chi_def: （用於代替 where 加以強調，通常表示驚訝）究竟在哪裡；究竟到哪裡
wherever.eg: Wherever did you find that hat!

whether.eng_def: (used especially in reporting questions and expressing doubts) if, or not
whether.chi_def: （尤用於轉述問題或表達疑問）是否
whether.eg: I wasn't sure whether you'd like it.

whether.eng_def: (used to introduce two or more possibilities) it is not important if
whether.chi_def: （用於引出兩種或多種可能性）不管…還是…；或者…或者…
whether.eg: I'm going, whether she likes it or not.

which.eng_def: (used in questions and structures in which there is a fixed or limited set of answers or possibilities) what one or ones
which.chi_def: （用於答案數目固定或有限的問題中）哪個；哪些
which.eg: Which party would you prefer to go to - Anna's or Dan's ?

which.eng_def: used to add extra information to a previous clause, in writing usually after a comma
which.chi_def: （用於為前面的從句補充額外資訊，書面英語中通常用於逗號之後）那個，那些，那種情況
which.eg: That bar on Milton Street, which by the way is very nice, is owned by Trevor's brother.

which.eng_def: used as the subject or object of a verb to show what thing or things you are referring to, or to add information about the thing just mentioned. It is usually used for things, not people
which.chi_def: （用作動詞的主詞或受詞，指代所提及的事物，或為剛提到的事物補充資訊，通常不用於指人）
which.eg: These are principles which we all believe in.

while.eng_def: during the time that, or at the same time as
while.eg: I read it while you were drying your hair.
While I accept that he's not perfect in many respects, I do actually like the man.

while.eng_def: compared with the fact that; but
while.eg: He gets £50,000 a year while I get a meagre £20,000!
I only stayed for a short while.

whine.eng_def: to make a long, high, sad sound
whine.eg: Leon's dog was sitting by the door whining, so I thought I'd better take it for a walk.

whine.eng_def: If you whine, especially as a child, you complain or express disappointment or unhappiness repeatedly.
whine.chi_def: （尤指小孩）不停地嘀咕，哼哼唧唧
whine.eg: Alice, if you keep whining I won't take you - do you understand?

whine.eng_def: an unpleasant high sound or voice
whine.eg: the whine of a circular saw

whip.eng_def: a piece of leather or rope that is fastened to a stick, used for hitting animals or people
whip.eg: She lashed the horses mercilessly with her long whip.

whip.eng_def: (in many elected political systems) a member of a political party in a parliament or in the legislature whose job is to make certain that other party members are present at voting time and also to make certain that they vote in a particular way
whip.chi_def: （政黨在議會或立法機關中監督該黨其他黨員在投票時出席並按規定投票的）組織秘書，黨鞭
whip.eg: Hargreaves is the MP who got into trouble with his party's chief whip for opposing the tax reform.

whip.eng_def: in British politics, a written order ordering that party members be present in parliament when there is to be an important vote, or that they vote in a particular way
whip.chi_def: （英國政界的）投票書面通知（通知該黨其他黨員出席議會並按規定投票）
whip.eg: In 1970 he defied the three-line (= most urgent) whip against EC membership.

whip.eng_def: a sweet food made from cream or beaten egg mixed together with fruit
whip.chi_def: （用雞蛋、鮮奶油與水果混合製成的）甜品

whip.eng_def: to bring or take something quickly
whip.eg: She whipped a handkerchief out of her pocket and wiped his face.

whip.eng_def: to (cause something to) move quickly and forcefully
whip.eg: The wind whipped across the half-frozen lake.

whip.eng_def: to beat food, especially cream, with a special piece of equipment in order to make it thick and firm
whip.chi_def: 攪打（尤指鮮奶油）使成糊狀
whip.eg: Could you whip the cream for me?

whip.eng_def: to hit a person or animal with a whip
whip.eg: I don't like the way the drivers whip their horses.

whirl.eng_def: to (cause something to) turn around in circles
whirl.eg: She saw a mass of bodies whirling around on the dance floor.

whirl.eng_def: a continuous and exciting period of activity
whirl.eg: The next two days passed in a whirl of activity.

whirl.eng_def: the action of turning around in circles or something that turns around in circles

whisk.eng_def: to take something or someone somewhere else suddenly and quickly
whisk.eg: Our coffees were whisked away before we'd even finished them.

whisk.eng_def: to beat eggs, cream, etc. with a special tool in order to add air and make the food light
whisk.eg: Whisk the egg whites until stiff.

whisk.eng_def: a kitchen tool that you use for beating food such as eggs and cream in order to add air and make it light
whisk.eg: Using a whisk, blend the ingredients thoroughly.

whiskey.eng_def: a strong, pale brown alcoholic drink, originally from Scotland and Ireland, made from grain such as barley, maize, or rye

whisky.eng_def: a strong, pale brown alcoholic drink, originally from Scotland and Ireland, made from grain such as barley, maize, or rye

whisper.eng_def: to speak very quietly, using the breath but not the voice, so that only the person close to you can hear you
whisper.eg: She leaned over and whispered something in his ear.

whisper.eng_def: to suggest privately that something might be true
whisper.eg: People are whispering that she's going to retire next year.

whisper.eng_def: a way of speaking very quietly, using the breath but not the voice, so that only the person close to you can hear you
whisper.eg: I heard whispers outside my room.
The silence was broken only by the whisper of the leaves in the gentle breeze.

whisper.eng_def: a suggestion or piece of information that you hear privately from someone
whisper.eg: I've heard a whisper that they're heading for divorce.

whistle.eng_def: to make a high sound by forcing air through a small hole or passage, especially through the lips, or through a special device held to the lips
whistle.chi_def: 吹哨子；（尤指）吹口哨；用口哨吹出

whistle.eng_def: to make a long, high sound while moving quickly through or past something
whistle.eg: She heard the wind whistling through the trees and the howl of a distant wolf.

whistle.eng_def: When birds whistle, they sing in high musical notes.
whistle.eg: The birds were whistling in the early morning quiet.

whistle.eng_def: the sound made by someone or something whistling
whistle.eg: I recognized my father's tuneless whistle.

whistle.eng_def: an object that you hold to your lips and blow through in order to make a loud, high sound
whistle.eg: The referee blew his whistle for half-time.

white.eng_def: of a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone
having a pale face because you are not well, or you are feeling shocked
white.chi_def: （因為生病或受到驚嚇）面色慘白的，蒼白的
white.eg: She was white, and her lips were pale.

white.eng_def: used in the names of various food and drink products, many of which are not pure white but slightly cream, yellow, grey, or transparent
belonging to the group of people with skin that is pale in colour, who come from or whose family originally came from Europe
white.eg: He had a black mother and a white father.

white.eng_def: a colour like that of snow, milk, or bone
white.eg: In some countries it is traditional for a bride to wear white.

white.eng_def: white clothes, either worn for a particular activity or job, or put together to be washed at the same time
the part of the eye that is white
white.eg: Don't shoot until you see the whites of their eyes (= until the people are very close to you).

white.eng_def: the transparent part of an egg that surrounds the yolk and becomes white when cooked
white.eg: Beat four egg whites into stiff peaks.

white.eng_def: a person with skin that is pale in colour, who comes from or whose family originally came from Europe
white.eg: The neighbourhood is populated mainly by whites.

whole.eg: I spent the whole day cleaning.
I have a whole pile of work to do this afternoon.

whole.eng_def: as a single object and not in pieces
whole.eg: The seeds can be eaten whole or ground in a coffee grinder.
Now he's arrived, it's a whole different situation.
I'll be on holiday the whole of next week.

wholesale.eng_def: of or for the selling of goods in large amounts at low prices to shops and businesses, rather than the selling of goods in shops to customers
(especially of something bad or too extreme) complete or affecting a lot of things, people, places, etc.
wholesale.chi_def: （尤指壞事或過於極端的事）完全的（地），大規模的（地）
