wholesale.eng_def: the price at which goods are sold to shops by the people who produce them, rather than the price which the customer usually pays in the shop
wholesale.eg: I bought my coat direct from the factory at wholesale.

wholesome.eng_def: good for you, and likely to improve your life either physically, morally, or emotionally

why.eng_def: used to express surprise or anger
why.chi_def: 喲，嗨，哎呀（表示驚訝或生氣）
why.eg: Why, if it isn't old Georgie Frazer!
I know very little about the whys and the wherefores of the situation.

wicked.eg: It was a wicked thing to do.

wicked.eng_def: slightly immoral or bad for you, but in an attractive way

wide.eng_def: having a larger distance from one side to the other than is usual or expected, especially in comparison with the length of something; not narrow
used when describing how long the distance between the two sides of something is or when asking for this information
wide.eg: The rectangle is 5 cm long and 1.9 cm wide.

wide.eng_def: used to describe something that includes a large amount or many different types of thing, or that covers a large range or area
wide.eg: They sell a wide range of skin-care products.

wide.eng_def: farther than usual, or as far as possible
completely, or by a large amount
wide.eg: She left the door wide open.

widen.eng_def: to become, or to make something greater in width
widen.eg: As it approaches the sea, the river begins to widen (out).

widen.eng_def: to (cause something to) become larger or to include a larger amount or number

widespread.eng_def: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people
widespread.eg: There are reports of widespread flooding in northern France.

widow.eng_def: a woman whose husband or wife has died and who has not married again
a woman whose partner is often not at home because he or she is fishing or playing football or golf
widow.chi_def: （丈夫因釣魚、踢足球或打高爾夫而經常不在家的）釣魚／足球／高爾夫活寡婦

widow.eng_def: If someone has been widowed, their husband or wife has died
widow.eg: He was widowed at the age of 52.

widower.eng_def: a man whose wife or husband has died and who has not married again

width.eng_def: the distance across something from one side to the other
width.eg: It is five metres in width.

width.eng_def: the distance across a swimming pool from one side to the other
width.eg: I managed to swim two widths underwater.

wife.eng_def: the woman that you are married to
wife.eg: I met Greg's wife for the first time.

wig.eng_def: a covering of artificial hair worn on the head to hide a loss of hair or to cover your own hair
wig.eg: She was wearing a blonde wig.

wild.eng_def: very unusual, often in a way that is attractive or exciting
wild.chi_def: 不尋常的；極棒的；非凡的
wild.eg: Those are wild trousers you're wearing, Maddy.

wild.eng_def: used to refer to plants or animals that live or grow independently of people, in natural conditions and with natural characteristics
wild.chi_def: 野生的；未經栽培的；未經馴化的

wild.eng_def: Wild land is not used to grow crops and has few people living in it.
wild.chi_def: 荒無人煙的；未經開墾的

wild.eng_def: something that you say that is not based on facts and is probably wrong
wild.chi_def: 毫無根據的指控／猜測／謠言

wild.eng_def: in natural conditions, independent of humans
wild.eg: Animals would produce more young in the wild than they do in the zoo.

wild.eng_def: in an area that is far from where people usually live and difficult to get to, and that is not considered easy to live in
wild.eg: She lives somewhere in the wilds of Borneo.

wilderness.eng_def: an area of land that has not been used to grow crops or had towns and roads built on it, especially because it is difficult to live in as a result of its extremely cold or hot weather or bad earth
an outside area in which plants are left to grow naturally or untidily
wilderness.eg: The garden was a wilderness of weeds and overgrown bushes.

wildlife.eng_def: animals and plants that grow independently of people, usually in natural conditions

will.eng_def: used to talk about what is going to happen in the future, especially things that you are certain about or things that are planned
will.eg: Clare will be five years old next month.

will.eng_def: used to talk about what someone or something is able or willing to do
used to ask someone to do something
will.eg: Will you give me her address?

will.eng_def: used as a polite way of inviting someone to do something, or of offering someone something
will.chi_def: （用於禮貌地提出邀請或提供某物）
will.eg: Will you join us for a cup of coffee, Evie?

will.chi_def: （用於以 if 開頭的條件句中）
will.eg: If he's late again, I'll be very angry.

will.eng_def: used to refer to what is likely
will.eg: That'll be Scott at the door.

will.eng_def: used when angry to tell someone to do something
will.eg: Will you stop being such a pain!

will.eng_def: used when referring to something that always or usually happens
the mental power used to control and direct your thoughts and actions, or a determination to do something, despite any difficulties or opposition
will.eg: From an early age she had a very strong will.

will.eng_def: an official statement of what a person has decided should be done with their money and property after their death
will.eg: Have you made a will yet?

will.eng_def: If you will something to happen, you try to make it happen by the power of your thoughts.
will.chi_def: 設法用意志力驅使；決意
will.eg: She willed herself to remember his name.
Stay or go, as you will.

will.eng_def: to arrange to give money or property to others after your death

willing.eng_def: to be happy to do something if it is needed
willing.eg: If you're willing to fly at night, you can get a much cheaper ticket.

willing.eng_def: A willing person does their work energetically and enthusiastically.

willow.eng_def: a tree that grows near water and has long, thin branches that hang down, or wood from this tree

win.eng_def: to achieve first position and/or get a prize in a competition, election, fight, etc.
win.eg: Which year was it that Italy won the World Cup?

win.eng_def: to receive something positive, such as approval, loyalty, or love because you have earned it
win.chi_def: 獲得，贏得（贊同、忠誠、好感、愛情等）
win.eg: Her plans have won the support of many local people.

win.eng_def: an occasion when someone wins a game or competition
win.eg: It was the team's sixth consecutive win this season.

wind.eng_def: a current of air moving approximately horizontally, especially one strong enough to be felt
wind.eg: There isn't enough wind to fly a kite.

wind.eng_def: breath or the ability to breathe
wind.eg: The blow to my stomach knocked the wind out of me.

wind.eng_def: words that do not mean anything and false statements
wind.eg: I rarely bother to listen to politicians' speeches - it's all just wind.

wind.eng_def: gas in the bowels or in a baby's stomach, especially when this makes you feel uncomfortable or makes noises
wind.eg: I like garlic but it gives me terrible wind.

wind.eng_def: the group of woodwind instruments (= ones played by blowing into a hole near one end)and their players in an orchestra
to make it difficult or temporarily impossible for someone to breathe, usually by hitting them in the stomach
wind.chi_def: （擊打腹部而）使氣急，使呼吸困難

wind.eng_def: to rub or very gently hit a baby on the back to allow air to come up from the stomach
wind.chi_def: （用撫拍的方法）使（嬰兒）打嗝通氣

wind.eng_def: to turn or cause something to turn
wind.eg: She wound the handle but nothing happened.

wind.eng_def: If you wind (up) a clock or watch, you cause it to work by turning a key, handle, or other device.
If a road, path, or river winds, it follows a route that turns repeatedly in different directions.
wind.chi_def: （道路或河流等）曲折前進，蜿蜒
wind.eg: The river winds through the valley.

wind.eng_def: to wrap something around an object several times or twist it repeatedly around itself
wind.eg: She wound a scarf around her neck.

wind.eng_def: A winding path, road, river, etc. repeatedly turns in different directions.
wind.eg: There's a very long, winding path leading up to the house.

window.eng_def: a space usually filled with glass in the wall of a building or in a vehicle, to allow light and air in and to allow people inside the building to see out
window.eg: Is it all right if I open/close the window?

window.eng_def: something that makes it possible for you to see and learn about a situation or experience that is different from your own
window.chi_def: （讓人了解其他情況或經歷的）窗口
window.eg: The film provides a window on the immigrant experience.

window.eng_def: a transparent rectangle on the front of an envelope, through which you can read the address written on the letter inside
the decorative arrangement of goods behind the window at the front of a shop, in addition to the window itself
window.eg: How much is the jacket in the window?

window.eng_def: a separate area on a computer screen that shows information and can be moved around
a period when there is an opportunity to do something
window.eg: I'm busy this week but there might be a window on Friday.

windshield.eng_def: the window at the front of a car, truck, etc.
something that gives protection from the wind, such as a row of trees, bushes, or a wall

wine.eng_def: an alcoholic drink that is usually made from grapes, but can also be made from other fruits or flowers. It is made by fermenting the fruit with water and sugar
to entertain someone by giving them food and drinks
wine.eg: The survey concludes that most women like to be wined and dined on the first few dates.

wing.eng_def: the flat part of the body that a bird, insect, or bat uses for flying, or one of the flat, horizontal structures that stick out from the side of an aircraft and support it when it is flying
wing.eg: the delicacy of a butterfly's wings

wing.eng_def: If a bird takes wing, it flies away.
to suddenly develop, freely and powerfully
wing.eg: She walked in the hills, letting her thoughts take wing.

wing.eng_def: A bird that is on the wing is flying.
a group within a political party or organization whose beliefs are in some way different from those of the main group
wing.eg: The president is on the left wing of the Democratic party.

wing.eng_def: a part of a large building that sticks out from the main part, often having been added at a later date
wing.chi_def: （常指後來增建的）建築翼部，廂房，側廳
wing.eg: The maternity department will be in the new wing of the hospital.

wing.eng_def: one of the four parts at the side of a car that go over the wheels
wing.eg: There's a dent in the left wing.

wing.eng_def: (in various team games, such as football and hockey) either of the two sides of the sports field, or a player whose position is at either of the two sides of the field
wing.chi_def: （足球、曲棍球等集體項目的）側翼位置，側翼隊員，邊鋒隊員
wing.eg: Zinoli passes the ball to Pereira out there on the wing.

wing.eng_def: the sides of a stage that cannot be seen by the people watching the play
wing.eg: I was in the wings waiting for my cue to come on stage.

wing.eng_def: to perform or speak without having prepared what you are going to do or say
wing.eg: I didn't have time to prepare for the talk, so I just had to wing it.

wink.eng_def: to close one eye for a short time as a way of greeting someone or showing friendliness, sexual interest, etc., or of showing that you are not serious about something you have said
wink.eg: Laura winked at me as Stephen turned his back.

wink.eng_def: When lights wink, they keep flashing on and off quickly.
wink.eg: Reflected in the water, the lights winked at us from the other side of the lake.

wink.eng_def: the action of winking at someone
wink.eg: He gave me a conspiratorial wink as they left the room.

winner.eng_def: someone who wins a game, competition, or election
winner.eg: There'll be a prize for the winner.

winner.eng_def: in sport, a goal or point that causes a player or team to win a game
winner.chi_def: （體育比賽中）致勝的一分，關鍵的一分
winner.eg: Neil Eaves scored the winner in the last minute of the match.

winner.eng_def: something that is extremely successful and popular
winner.chi_def: 極其成功的事物；非常受歡迎的事物
winner.eg: That lemon tart was a winner, wasn't it?

winter.eng_def: the season between autumn and spring, lasting from November to March north of the equator and from May to September south of the equator, when the weather is coldest
winter.eg: I think you tend to eat more in (the) winter.

winter.eng_def: (especially of a bird) to spend the winter in a particular place
winter.eg: Birds migrate so that they can winter in a warmer country.

wipe.eng_def: to slide something, especially a piece of cloth, over the surface of something else, in order to remove dirt, food, or liquid
wipe.eg: Do you have some paper towels that I can wipe the floor with?

wipe.eng_def: a piece of soft, wet cloth or paper that you use for wiping

wipe.eg: I'd better give the floor a quick wipe before someone slips on it.

wire.eng_def: a piece of thin metal thread that can be bent, used for fastening things and for making particular types of objects that are strong but can bend
(a piece of) thin metal thread with a layer of plastic around it, used for carrying electric current
wire.eg: Someone had cut the phone wires.

wire.eng_def: a secret recording device hidden worn by a person, especially one that is hidden in their clothes
wire.eg: The undercover police officer was wearing a wire during the meeting.

wire.eng_def: the wire fence around a prison or prison camp
wire.eg: During the war he spent three years behind the wire (= in prison).

wire.eng_def: to fasten two things together using wire
wire.eg: She had her jaws wired together so that she wouldn't be able to eat.

wire.eng_def: to connect a piece of electrical equipment with wires so that it will work
wire.chi_def: 為（電子設備）接上電線（或導線）
wire.eg: The stereo wasn't working because it hadn't been wired up correctly.

wire.eng_def: to send money using an electrical communication system
wire.eg: The insurance company wired millions of dollars to its accounts to cover the payments.

wire.eng_def: in the past, to send someone a telegram
wire.eg: Janet wired me to say she'd be here a day later than planned.

wisdom.eng_def: the ability to use your knowledge and experience to make good decisions and judgments
wisdom.eg: I certainly hope to gain a little wisdom as I grow older.

wise.eng_def: having or showing the ability to make good judgments, based on a deep understanding and experience of life
wise.eg: I think you made a wise choice.

wise.eng_def: understanding a dishonest situation or way of doing something
wise.chi_def: 意識到，覺察（令人不愉快的實情）
wise.eg: People are getting wise to the tricks politicians use in campaign advertisements.

wise.eng_def: in this way or in this direction

wise.eg: What shall we do food-wise - do you fancy going out to eat?

wish.eng_def: used with the past simple to express that you feel sorry or sad about a state or situation that exists at the moment
wish.chi_def: （與過去時連用，對已經存在的情況表示遺憾）但願，希望
wish.eg: I wish (that) I was/were a bit taller.

wish.eng_def: used with the past perfect to express that you feel sorry or sad about a particular action in the past
wish.chi_def: （與過去完成時連用，對過去某事表示悔恨）但願，希望
wish.eg: I wish (that) I hadn't eaten so much.
As you wish, Sir. It will be done.

wish.eng_def: used to express anger at someone's behaviour
wish.chi_def: （用來表示對某人行為的厭煩）我希望…
wish.eg: I wish she'd shut up for a minute and let someone else talk.

wish.eng_def: to hope or express hope for another person's success or happiness or pleasure on a particular occasion
wish.eg: We wish you every success in the future.
I wished him well with his new venture.

wish.eng_def: to hope that something you want will be made real because of good luck or magical powers
wish.chi_def: 希望（因為好運或魔力而）夢想成真
wish.eg: I remember blowing out the candles on my birthday cake and wishing that John Lee would be my boyfriend.

wish.eng_def: to welcome someone with particular words or a particular action
wish.chi_def: （用特定的言辭或舉動）歡迎，問候

wish.eg: Did he express any wish to see me?

wish.eng_def: something you say or write at the end of a letter, etc. to show that you hope someone is happy and has good luck
wish.eg: He ended the letter "Best wishes, Carlo".

wish.eng_def: a hope that is made real with magical powers
wish.eg: If I could have just one wish I suppose it would be that all the fighting in the world would stop tomorrow.

wit.eng_def: the ability to use words in a clever and humorous way
wit.eg: a woman of great intelligence and wit

wit.eng_def: a person who is skilled at using words in a clever and humorous way
wit.eg: Sydney Smith, a notable wit, once remarked that he never read a book before he reviewed it because it might prejudice his opinion of it.

wit.eng_def: intelligence and the ability to think quickly
wit.eg: She learned to survive on her wits.

witch.eng_def: a woman who is believed to have magical powers and who uses them to harm or help other people

with.eng_def: used to say that people or things are in a place together or are doing something together
with.eg: I was with Sylvia at the time.
He was shot at close range with a pistol.
a tall woman with dark hair

with.eng_def: used at the beginning of various phrases written at the end of a letter

with.eg: With your contribution, that makes a total of £45.

with.eng_def: relating to or in the case of a person or thing
used to show what is on or in something
with.eg: She laid the table with the best china.

with.eng_def: because of or caused by someone or something

with.eg: I ended up having an argument with her.
I'd rather not part with my cash.
I'd like a steak and fries with apple pie for dessert.
I have nothing in common with my brother.
If you want to go for a promotion, I'll be with you all the way.

with.eng_def: in the same direction as something
with.eg: The wind was with me on the home stretch and I ran well.

with.eng_def: at the same rate or time as something
with.eg: This wine will improve with age.

with.eng_def: to understand what someone is saying
with.eg: You look puzzled - are you with me?
With all her faults, she's still a really good friend.

with.eng_def: used to express a wish or instruction

withdraw.eng_def: to take or move out or back, or to remove
withdraw.chi_def: 抽回；取回；提取；撤回；撤離；退出；移回
withdraw.eg: This credit card allows you to withdraw up to £200 a day from ATMs.

withdraw.eng_def: to stop talking to other people and start thinking thoughts that are not related to what is happening around you
withdraw.chi_def: 不再說話；沉默；不與人交流
withdraw.eg: As a child, she frequently withdrew into her own fantasy world.

wither.eng_def: (to cause) to become weak and dry and decay
wither.eg: Grass had withered in the fields.

wither.eng_def: to slowly disappear, lose importance, or become weaker
wither.eg: This country is in danger of allowing its industrial base to wither away.

within.eng_def: inside or not further than an area or period of time
within.eg: Two thirds of Californians live within 15 miles of the coast.

without.eng_def: not having or doing something, or lacking something

withstand.eng_def: to be strong enough, or not be changed by something, or to oppose a person or thing successfully
withstand.eg: a bridge designed to withstand earthquakes

witness.eng_def: a person who sees an event happening, especially a crime or an accident
witness.eg: Police are appealing for witnesses to the accident to come forward.
She was witness to the tragic event.

witness.eng_def: someone who is asked to be present at a particular event and sign their name in order to prove that things have been done correctly
witness.eg: He signed the treaty in the presence of two witnesses.

witness.eng_def: a person in a law court who says what they know about a legal case or a particular person
witness.eg: Ten witnesses are expected to testify at the trial today.

witness.eng_def: a person who is allowed to give their opinion in a law court because of their knowledge or practical experience of a particular subject
witness.eg: A psychiatrist was called as an expert witness for the defence.

witness.eng_def: to see something happen, especially an accident or crime
witness.chi_def: 目擊，看到（尤指事故或犯罪）

witness.eng_def: to be present at an event and to sign your name as proof that it happened or that it was done correctly
witness.eg: Her will was witnessed by two colleagues.

witness.eng_def: When a place or period witnesses a particular event, the event happens in that place or during that period.
witness.eg: This university has witnessed quite a few changes over the years.

witness.eng_def: to show or give proof of something
witness.eg: This year's charity ball was the most successful one ever, as witnessed by the number of tickets sold.

witty.eng_def: using words in a clever and funny way

wizard.eng_def: a man who is believed to have magical powers and who uses them to harm or help other people
someone who is an expert at something or who has great ability in a particular subject

woe.eg: The country has been beset by economic woes for the past decade.
Her face was lined and full of woe.

wolf.eng_def: a wild animal of the dog family
wolf.eg: Wolves hunt in groups known as packs.

wolf.eng_def: a man who often tries to have sex with the women he meets
wolf.eg: He had the reputation of being a bit of a wolf.

wolf.eng_def: to eat a large amount of food very quickly
wolf.eg: The boys wolfed the sandwiches (down) and then started on the cake.

woman.eng_def: a wife or female sexual partner
woman.eg: Apparently, Jeff has a new woman.
He is writing a book on the representation of woman in medieval art.

woman.eng_def: used to form nouns describing certain types of women or women with certain jobs
woman.chi_def: （用以構成名詞，形容某一類或從事某種特定職業的）女性

wonder.eng_def: to ask yourself questions or express a wish to know about something
wonder.eg: Shouldn't you phone home? Your parents will be wondering where you are.

wonder.eng_def: used in phrases, at the beginning of a request, to make it more formal and polite
wonder.chi_def: （用於片語中，使請求更加正式和禮貌）不知能否…
wonder.eg: We were wondering if/whether you'd like to have dinner with us some time?

wonder.eng_def: to feel or express great surprise at something
wonder.eg: I don't wonder (that) she burst into tears after the way you spoke to her.

wonder.eng_def: a feeling of great surprise and admiration caused by seeing or experiencing something that is strange and new
wonder.eg: The sight of the Grand Canyon stretching out before them filled them with wonder.

wonder.eng_def: an object that causes a feeling of great surprise and admiration
wonder.eg: We spent a week visiting the wonders of Ancient Greek civilization.

wonder.eng_def: an extremely useful or skilful person
wonder.eg: Our new babysitter's a wonder - she'll come at very short notice and the kids love her.

wonderful.chi_def: 絕妙的，令人驚嘆的，極好的

woo.eng_def: to try to persuade someone to support you or to use your business
woo.eg: The party has been trying to woo the voters with promises of electoral reform.

woo.eng_def: If a man woos a woman, he gives her a lot of attention in an attempt to persuade her to marry him.
woo.eg: He wooed her for months with flowers and expensive presents.

wood.eng_def: a hard substance that forms the branches and trunks of trees and can be used as a building material, for making things, or as a fuel
wood.eg: He gathered some wood to build a fire.

wood.eng_def: a type of golf club (= long, thin stick) with a rounded wooden end, used for hitting the ball over long distances
wood.chi_def: （頂部為木製的高爾夫球）球杆
wood.eg: He likes to use a number 2 wood to tee off.

wood.eng_def: an area of land covered with a thick growth of trees

wood.eg: Solid wood furniture is sturdy and durable.

wooden.eg: The house was surrounded by a tall, wooden fence.

wooden.eng_def: used to describe behaviour that is awkward or shows little expression
wooden.eg: She gave a wooden smile to the camera.

woodpecker.eng_def: a bird that uses its strong beak to make holes in tree trunks in order to find insects to eat

wool.eng_def: the soft, thick hair that grows on the bodies of sheep and some other animals
wool.eg: Australia is one of the world's main producers of wool.

wool.eng_def: thick thread or material that is made from this
wool.eg: Put on your red wool cardigan - it'll be nice and warm.

word.eng_def: a single unit of language that has meaning and can be spoken or written
word.eg: Your essay should be no more than two thousand words long.

word.eng_def: used to refer to a word, usually a rude or embarrassing one, by saying only the first letter and not the whole word
word.chi_def: 那個以F開頭的詞／以C開頭的詞（通常是粗魯或令人難堪的詞，只說出該詞的第一個字母來指代）
word.eg: You're still not allowed to say the F-word on TV in the US
Both competitors had words (= argued) after the match.
So far there have been more words than action on the matter of childcare provision.

word.eng_def: to talk to each other for a short time
word.eg: We exchanged a few words as we were coming out of the meeting.

word.eng_def: a statement of approval and support for someone or something
word.chi_def: （表示贊同或支持某人或某事的）好話
word.eg: If you see the captain could you put in a good word for me?
Has there been any word from Paul since he went to New York?
I said I'd visit him and I will keep my word.
We're waiting for the word from head office before making a statement.

word.eng_def: to choose the words you use when you are saying or writing something
word.eg: He worded the reply in such a way that he did not admit making the original error.

work.eng_def: an activity, such as a job, that a person uses physical or mental effort to do, usually for money
work.eg: I've got so much work to do.

work.eng_def: the material used by someone at work, or what they produce
work.eg: I'll have to take this work home with me and finish it there.

work.eng_def: a place where a person goes specially to do their job
work.eg: Do you have far to travel to work each day?

work.eng_def: something created as a result of effort, especially a painting, book, or piece of music
work.chi_def: （尤指繪畫、書籍或音樂）作品，著作
work.eg: The museum has many works by Picasso as well as other modern painters.

work.eng_def: everything that you might want or expect to find in a particular situation
work.eg: The bridegroom was wearing a morning suit, gloves, top hat - the works.

work.eng_def: an industrial building, especially one where a lot of people are employed
the parts of a machine, especially those that move
work.eg: If you take the back off this clock, you can see its/the works.
Her idea for reorganizing the department will never work in practice.

work.eng_def: to do a job, especially the job you do to earn money, or to make someone do a job
work.chi_def: （使）工作；（使）勞動；（使）做事（尤指為了賺錢）

work.eng_def: If a machine or device works, it operates, especially correctly and without failure, and if you work it, you make it operate.
to succeed gradually in becoming something or cause a person or thing to become something, either by making an effort or by making many small movements
work.eg: He started as a technician and worked his way up through the company to become managing director.

work.eng_def: to arrange for something to happen, especially by not using official methods and/or by being clever
work.chi_def: （尤指不透過官方認可的方式或巧妙地）安排
work.eg: I don't know how she worked it, but she retired at 50.

work.eng_def: to shape, change, or process a substance
work.eg: Working iron requires higher temperatures than bronze.

work.eng_def: used to refer to work of a particular type
used to refer to a skill or activity using a particular type of material
work.chi_def: 使用（某種材料）的手藝（或活動）
work.eg: Girls and boys study woodwork and metalwork at this school.

work.eng_def: used to name things made of a particular material

worker.eng_def: someone who works in a particular job or in a particular way
someone who works for a company or organization but does not have a powerful position
worker.eg: Many companies still treat their management staff better than their workers.

worker.eng_def: in bees and some other types of insects, a female that cannot produce young but collects food for the others

workshop.eng_def: a room or building where things are made or repaired using machines and/or tools
a meeting of people to discuss and/or perform practical work in a subject or activity
to prepare a play for being shown in a theatre by discussing and working on different versions of it
workshop.chi_def: （正式演出前）預演（常伴有討論、對不同版本的修改等）
workshop.eg: The show was workshopped in May 2014 at the Courtyard Theatre.

world.eng_def: the earth and all the people, places, and things on it
world.eg: Different parts of the world have very different climatic conditions.

world.eng_def: a group of things such as countries or animals, or an area of human activity or understanding
a planet or other part of the universe, especially one where life might or does exist
world.chi_def: （尤指可能或確有生命存在的）星球，天體
world.eg: There was a man on the news last night who believes we've been visited by beings from other worlds.

worm.eng_def: a small animal with a long, narrow, soft body without arms, legs, or bones
worm.eg: The kiwi bird eats worms, other invertebrates, and berries.

worm.eng_def: the young of particular types of insect
worm.eg: It's distressing enough to find a worm in your apple but finding half of one is worse.

worm.eng_def: a type of worm that lives in an animal's intestine, feeding on the food there, or on an animal's body, feeding off its blood
an unpleasant person who does not deserve respect
worm.eg: Don't be such a worm. You don't have to lie to me.

worm.eng_def: to succeed in moving along in a difficult or crowded situation, by moving your body slowly and carefully
worm.eg: Because he was so small, he could worm (his way) through the crowd.

worm.eng_def: to give an animal, especially a pet dog or cat, medicine to kill any worms that might be living inside it

worry.eng_def: to think about problems or unpleasant things that might happen in a way that makes you feel unhappy and frightened
worry.eg: Try not to worry - there's nothing you can do to change the situation.

worry.eng_def: to make someone feel unhappy and frightened because of problems or unpleasant things that might happen
worry.eg: You worried your mother by not writing.

worry.eng_def: If a dog worries another animal, it chases and frightens it and might also bite it.
worry.eg: Any dog caught worrying sheep in these fields will be shot.

worry.eng_def: a problem that makes you feel unhappy and frightened
a feeling of being unhappy and frightened about something
worry.eg: Unemployment, bad health - all sorts of things can be a cause of worry.

worry.eng_def: used to tell someone that a situation is acceptable, even if something has gone wrong
worry.chi_def: （用以告訴某人）不必擔心，沒關係
worry.eg: "Oh, I'm sorry I got your name wrong!" "No worries".

worse.eng_def: comparative of  bad : more unpleasant, difficult, or severe than before or than something else that is also bad
worse.eg: The conditions they're living in are worse than we thought.

worse.eng_def: to become more ill, or to become a more severe condition
worse.eg: My cold seems to be getting worse.

worse.eng_def: something that is more unpleasant or difficult
worse.eg: By the third month of the expedition they had endured many hardships, but worse was to follow.
He did worse than he was expecting in the exams.

worship.eng_def: to have or show a strong feeling of respect and admiration for God or a god
worship.chi_def: 敬奉，崇拜，信仰（上帝或神）
worship.eg: On the island the people worshipped different gods.

worship.eng_def: to go to a religious ceremony
worship.chi_def: 參加宗教儀式；敬神；拜神
worship.eg: They socialize together and worship in the same mosque.

worship.eng_def: to love, respect, and admire someone or something very much, often without noticing the bad qualities of that person or thing
the act of worshipping God or a god, often through praying or singing
a lot of love or admiration for a particular thing or person, often when this is considered too much
worship.eg: We're in an era of fitness and health worship.

worship.eng_def: used as a title of respect when speaking to or about a mayor or a magistrate
worship.chi_def: （對市長和治安官的尊稱）閣下
worship.eg: His Worship the Mayor will present the awards.

worst.eng_def: superlative of  bad : of the lowest quality, or the most unpleasant, difficult, or severe
worst.chi_def: 最差的；最糟的；最嚴重的
worst.eg: That was the worst meal I've ever eaten.

worst.eng_def: the most unpleasant or difficult thing, person, or situation
worst.chi_def: 最壞的人（或事）；最糟的情況
worst.eg: That was the worst I've seen him play in several years.

worst.chi_def: 最差地；最糟地；最嚴重地
worst.eg: Small businesses have been worst hit by the recession.

worst.eng_def: used to emphasize what is worst about a situation
worst.chi_def: （用以強調）最差的是，最糟的是
worst.eg: We had no food or light, but worst of all, we had no water.

worst.eng_def: to defeat someone in a fight or argument
worst.eg: He was worsted in a fight with a bigger boy.

worth.eng_def: having a particular value, especially in money
having a particular amount of money
worth.eg: She must be worth at least half a million.

worth.eng_def: to be of reasonable or good value for the price
worth.eg: Four days' car hire costs £150, which is well worth it for the freedom it gives you.

worth.eng_def: to be important or interesting enough to receive a particular action
worth.eg: I think this matter is worth our attention.

worth.eng_def: to be important or useful to have or do
worth.eg: There's nothing worth reading in this newspaper.

worth.eng_def: enjoyable enough or producing enough advantages to make the necessary effort, risk, pain, etc. seem acceptable
worth.chi_def: 值得（努力、冒險、忍受痛苦等）去做
worth.eg: It was a long climb to the top of the hill, but it was worth it for the view from the top.

worth.eng_def: the amount of money that something can be sold for; value
worth.eg: The estimated worth of the plastics and petrochemical industry is about $640 billion.

worth.eng_def: the amount of something that you could buy for £20, $100, etc.
worth.eg: $4 million worth of souvenirs and gift items have been produced for the event.

worth.eng_def: the importance or usefulness of something or someone
worth.eg: He felt as though he had no worth.

worth.eng_def: an amount of something that will last a month, a year, etc. or that takes a month, a year, etc. to do
worth.chi_def: 可持續（或需花費）一個月／一年（等等）的…
worth.eg: a month's worth of grocery shopping

worthwhile.eng_def: useful, important, or good enough to be a suitable reward for the money or time spent or the effort made
worthwhile.chi_def: 值得的；值得花錢（或時間、精力）的
worthwhile.eg: She considers teaching a worthwhile career.

worthy.chi_def: 值得尊敬的；值得欽佩的；值得支持的
worthy.eg: He is unlikely to succeed in getting his bill through Congress, however worthy it is.

worthy.eng_def: deserving to be given attention, noticed, etc.
worthy.eg: Two points in this report are especially worthy of notice.

worthy.eng_def: Something that is worthy is not very interesting but should be admired for its good and useful qualities.
suitable for or characteristic of something
worthy.eg: He threw a party worthy of a millionaire.

worthy.eng_def: a person who is important, especially in a small town
worthy.chi_def: （尤指小城鎮中的）要人，大人物
worthy.eg: The front row of chairs was reserved for local worthies.

worthy.eng_def: suitable or deserving to receive a particular thing
used to describe a boat, aircraft, or vehicle that is suitable to be used safely in a particular substance or environment

wound.eng_def: a damaged area of the body, such as a cut or hole in the skin or flesh made by a weapon

wound.eg: She refuses to talk about the incident, saying it would only reopen old wounds (= make her remember unhappy past experiences).

wound.eng_def: to damage an area of the body, especially by making a cut or hole in the skin
wound.eg: Flying glass wounded her in the face and neck.
He was deeply wounded by her fierce criticism.

wound.eng_def: past simple and past participle of wind

wrap.eng_def: to cover or surround something with paper, cloth, or other material
wrap.eg: She wrapped the present and tied it with ribbon.

wrap.eng_def: to cover someone with a piece of material in order to protect them
wrap.eg: She wrapped the baby in a blanket.

wrap.eng_def: a sandwich made with one piece of very thin bread that is folded around a filling
material that is used to cover or protect objects
a loose piece of clothing that is worn tied around the body
a long piece of cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders to keep her warm or for decoration

wreath.eng_def: an arrangement of flowers and leaves in a circular shape, used as a decoration or as a sign of respect and remembrance for a person who has died

wreck.eng_def: to destroy or badly damage something
wreck.eg: The explosion shattered nearby windows and wrecked two cars.
He has been warned that his behaviour might wreck his chances of promotion.

wreck.eng_def: a vehicle or ship that has been destroyed or badly damaged
wreck.chi_def: 嚴重損毀的交通工具；沉船
wreck.eg: Divers exploring the wreck managed to salvage some coins and jewellery.

wreck.eng_def: someone who is in bad physical or mental condition
wreck.chi_def: 健康（或精神）嚴重受損的人
wreck.eg: The stress she had been under at work reduced her to a nervous/quivering wreck.

wrench.eng_def: to pull and twist something suddenly or violently away from its position
wrench.eg: The photographer tripped over the cord, wrenching a microphone from its stand.

wrench.eng_def: to twist part of your body badly, such as your arm or leg, and injure it
wrench.eg: He wrenched his right shoulder during a game of hockey.

wrench.eng_def: to suddenly take someone from people they love, causing them great unhappiness
wrench.eg: At the age of eight, she was wrenched from her foster parents and sent to live with another family.

wrench.eng_def: a tool for holding and turning objects, especially one that can be made larger and smaller to hold different sized objects
a sudden, violent twist or pull
a feeling of unhappiness when you have to leave a person or place that you love
wrench.chi_def: （被迫離開某人或某地時的）痛苦，難受
wrench.eg: She found leaving home a real wrench.

wrestle.eng_def: to fight with someone (especially as a sport) by holding them and trying to throw them to the ground
wrestle.chi_def: （尤指作為運動）（與…）摔跤，角力；（將…）摔倒
wrestle.eg: He has wrestled professionally for five years.

wring.eng_def: to hold something tightly with both hands and twist it by turning your hands in opposite directions
to twist a cloth or piece of clothing with your hands to remove water from it
wring.eg: She wrung out the shirt and hung it out to dry.

wring.eng_def: to kill a bird or other animal by twisting and breaking its neck
wring.chi_def: 擰斷（鳥或其他動物的）脖子；掐死

wrinkle.eng_def: a small line in the skin caused by old age
a small line or fold in cloth
a problem, usually a small one
wrinkle.eg: There are still a few wrinkles to iron out (= solve) before the agreement can be signed.

wrinkle.eng_def: If skin or material wrinkles, or if something wrinkles it, it gets small lines or folds in it.
wrinkle.eg: Sunbathing can prematurely age and wrinkle the skin.

wrinkle.eng_def: to make folds appear on your face above your eyes to show that you are surprised or confused
to show that you dislike something or that you disapprove of something by tightening the muscles in your nose so that small lines appear in the skin
wrinkle.chi_def: 皺起鼻子（表示不喜歡或不贊成）
wrinkle.eg: She wrinkled up her nose at the strange smell coming from the kitchen.

wrist.eng_def: the part of the body between the hand and the arm
wrist.eg: I sprained my wrist playing tennis.

write.eng_def: to make marks that represent letters, words, or numbers on a surface, such as paper or a computer screen, using a pen, pencil, or keyboard, or to use this method to record thoughts, facts, or messages
write.eg: When you fill in the form, please write clearly/legibly in black ink.

write.eng_def: to send a letter or message to someone, giving them information or expressing your thoughts or feelings
write.eg: She hasn't written to me (US also written me) recently.

write.eng_def: to put all the information that is needed on a document
write.eg: Please will you write (out) your name and address in full.

write.eng_def: to create and record something, such as a book, poem, song, or computer program, on paper or on a computer
write.chi_def: 創作，寫作；編寫（電腦程式）

write.eng_def: to have the job of creating books, stories, or articles that will be published
write.eg: She writes for a national newspaper.

write.eng_def: to say something in a book, newspaper, magazine, or document
write.chi_def: （在書籍、報刊或文件中）指出，寫道
write.eg: In the article, he writes that the problems in the refugee camps are getting worse.

write.eng_def: to record information in the memory of a computer
write.eg: There was a problem writing to the disk in the A drive.

writer.eng_def: a person who writes books or articles to be published

wrong.eg: Three of your answers were wrong.

wrong.eng_def: If someone is wrong, they are not correct in their judgment or statement about something.
wrong.eg: You were wrong about the time - the bank closed at 3.30.

wrong.eng_def: to show by your actions that someone's judgment of you was not correct
wrong.eg: I thought she couldn't do it, but she proved me wrong.

wrong.eng_def: not suitable or correct, or not as it should be
wrong.chi_def: 不合適的；不想要的；不應該的
wrong.eg: She's the wrong person for the job.

wrong.eng_def: Something that is wrong is not considered to be socially acceptable or suitable.
wrong.eg: She got in with the wrong crowd (= a group of people who behaved badly) at university.

wrong.eng_def: If you ask someone what is wrong, you want to know what is worrying or upsetting them.
wrong.eg: You've been quiet all evening. Is there anything wrong?

wrong.eng_def: If something is the wrong way around, the part that should be at the front is at the back.
wrong.chi_def: 前後弄反的（地），顛倒的（地）
wrong.eg: You've got your skirt on the wrong way round.

wrong.eng_def: not considered morally acceptable by most people
wrong.chi_def: 不道德的；不正當的；不對的
wrong.eg: Children should be taught that violence is wrong.

wrong.chi_def: 不正常運作的；出毛病的
wrong.eg: Something's wrong with the television - the picture's fuzzy.

wrong.eng_def: in a way that is not correct
to make a mistake in the way you answer or understand something
wrong.eg: I spent hours doing that problem and I still got the answer wrong.

wrong.eng_def: If a situation or event goes wrong, it becomes unpleasant and is not a success.
wrong.eg: Our marriage began to go wrong after we had our first child.
These shelves are very easy to put together - you can't go wrong.

wrong.eng_def: If a machine goes wrong, it stops working correctly.
what is considered to be morally unacceptable
wrong.eg: He has no sense of right and wrong.
He has done us a great wrong.

wrong.eng_def: If someone is in the wrong, they have made a mistake or done something that is bad or illegal.
wrong.eg: The driver was unquestionably in the wrong.

wrong.eng_def: to treat someone in an unfair or unacceptable way
wrong.eg: She felt deeply wronged by his accusations.

x-ray.eng_def: a type of radiation that can go through many solid substances, allowing hidden objects such as bones and organs in the body to be photographed
a photograph of a part of the body made using X-rays
x-ray.eg: The X-ray showed a slight irregularity in one lung.

x-ray.eng_def: an examination of a part of the body by taking and studying an X-ray photograph
x-ray.eg: She had an X-ray to see if any of her ribs were broken.

xerox.eng_def: a brand name for a copy of a document or other piece of paper with writing or printing on it, made by a machine that uses a photographic process, or the machine or process itself
xerox.chi_def: 靜電複印件；靜電複印機

xerox.eng_def: to make a copy of a document using a Xerox or other copying machine

yacht.eng_def: a boat with sails and sometimes an engine, used for either racing or travelling on for pleasure

yam.eng_def: a potato-like root from a tropical climbing plant that can be eaten, or the plant it grows from

yam.chi_def: 甘薯，白薯，紅薯，番薯（同 sweet potato）

yard.eng_def: a unit of measurement equal to three feet or approximately 91.4 centimetres
an area of land in which a particular type of work is done, often one from which goods are sold
yard.chi_def: （進行某種工作的）場地，場所；（常指出售貨物的）場地

yard.eng_def: an area of land next to a building that usually has a hard surface and that is used for a special purpose
yard.eg: The house has a small yard at the back.

yard.eng_def: a piece of land next to a house, usually used for growing flowers, grass, and other plants
yard.eg: The kids were playing in the yard.

yarn.eng_def: thread used for making cloth or for knitting
a story, usually a long one with a lot of excitement or interest
yarn.eg: He knew how to spin a good yarn (= tell a good story).

yawn.eng_def: to open the mouth wide and take a lot of air into the lungs and slowly send it out, usually when tired or bored
yawn.eg: I can't stop yawning - I must be tired.
Her eyes watered as she tried to stifle (= stop) a yawn.

yawn.eng_def: something or someone that is very boring
yawn.eg: The film was a total yawn.

yeah.eg: "Do you like your job?" "Yeah, it's all right I suppose."

year.eng_def: a period of twelve months, especially from 1 January to 31 December
year.chi_def: 年，年份，（尤指一月一日至十二月三十一日間的）一年時間
year.eg: Annette worked in Italy for two years.

year.eng_def: a period of twelve months relating to a particular activity
year.chi_def: （與某一活動有關的）一年，年度
year.eg: The financial/tax year begins in April.

year.eng_def: the part of the year, in a school or university, during which courses are taught
a group of students who start school, college, university, or a course together
year.eg: Kathy was in the year above me at college.

year.eng_def: used to refer to a student in a particular year group at a school, college, or university
year.eg: I like teaching the first-years, but the second-years can be difficult.

yearly.eng_def: every year or once every year
yearly.eg: We get a yearly pay increase.

yearn.eng_def: to wish very strongly, especially for something that you cannot have or something that is very difficult to have
yearn.eg: Despite his great commercial success he still yearns for critical approval.

yeast.eng_def: a type of fungus that is used in making alcoholic drinks such as beer and wine, and for making bread swell and become light

yell.eng_def: to shout something or make a loud noise, usually when you are angry, in pain, or excited
yell.chi_def: （通常指生氣、疼痛或激動時）叫喊，吼叫（著說）
yell.eg: Our neighbours were yelling (obscenities) at each other this morning.

yellow.eng_def: a colour like that of a lemon or gold or the sun
yellow.eg: It was early autumn and the leaves were turning yellow.

yellow.eng_def: of a colour like that of a lemon or gold or the sun
belonging to a race that has pale yellowish-brown skin
to become yellow, or to make something become yellow

yes.eng_def: used to express willingness or agreement
yes.chi_def: （用於表示接受、願意或贊同）好的，是的
yes.eg: "Would you like a glass of wine?" "Yes, thanks."
We visited all 50 states, yes sir, all 50.

yes.eng_def: used to show that you are listening to someone, or that you are ready to listen and to give them an answer or information
yes.chi_def: （用於表示正在聽某人說話，或準備聽並作出回答或提供資訊）

yes.eng_def: used when you are disagreeing with a negative statement
yes.eg: "I'm not a very good cook, though." "Yes, you are - you make wonderful food!"

yes.eng_def: a vote supporting a particular plan of action or a reply accepting an invitation
yes.eg: "Have you had any replies yet?" "Six yeses and two noes so far."

yesterday.eg: He called yesterday while you were out.
I called her the day before yesterday.
Nobody's interested in yesterday's pop stars.

yet.eg: I haven't spoken to her yet.

yet.eng_def: the best, worst, etc. until now
yet.chi_def: 迄今最好的／最差的（等等）
yet.eg: Of all the songs I've heard tonight, that's the best yet.
We haven't needed extra staff as yet, but we may in the future.

yet.eng_def: from now and for a particular period of time in the future
yet.chi_def: 從現在起至將來某個時間，還
yet.eg: She won't be back for a long time yet.

yet.eng_def: If you have yet to do something, you have not done it.
yet.eg: They have yet to make a decision.

yet.eng_def: even at this stage or time
yet.eg: We could yet succeed - you never know.

yet.eng_def: used to add emphasis to words such as another and again, especially to show an increase in amount or the number of times something happens
yet.chi_def: 再，還（用於強調 another 或 again 之類的詞，尤指數量增加或某事發生頻繁）
yet.eg: Rachel bought yet another pair of shoes to add to her collection.

yet.eng_def: (and) despite that; used to add something that seems surprising because of what you have just said

yield.eng_def: to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information
yield.eg: an attempt to yield increased profits

yield.eng_def: to give up the control of or responsibility for something, often because you have been forced to
yield.eg: They were forced to yield (up) their land to the occupying forces.

yield.eng_def: to bend or break under pressure
yield.eg: His legs began to yield under the sheer weight of his body.

yield.eng_def: to stop in order to allow other vehicles to go past, especially before you drive onto a bigger road
yield.chi_def: 停車讓道（以讓其他車輛通過）
yield.eg: If you're going downhill, you need to yield to bikers going uphill.

yield.eng_def: an amount of something positive, such as food or profit, that is produced or supplied

yoga.eng_def: a set of physical and mental exercises, originally from India, intended to give control over the body and mind
a Hindu system of philosophy that aims to unite the self with god
yoga.chi_def: 瑜伽派（印度一哲學體系）

yogurt.eng_def: a slightly sour, thick liquid made from milk with bacteria added to it, sometimes eaten plain and sometimes with sugar, fruit, etc. added

yolk.eng_def: the yellow, middle part of an egg
yolk.eg: I like eggs lightly cooked so that the yolk is still runny.

young.eng_def: having lived or existed for only a short time and not old
to look younger than you really are
young people considered together as a group
young.eg: I have nothing against miniskirts, but I think they're strictly for the young.
Meanwhile, the mother flies back to the nest to feed her young.

youngster.eng_def: a young person, usually an older child
youngster.eg: The scheme is for youngsters between the ages of ten and 16.

youth.eng_def: the period of your life when you are young, or the state of being young
youth.eg: I was a fairly good football player in my youth.

youth.eng_def: a boy or a young man
youth.eg: Gangs of youths were throwing stones and bottles at the police.

youth.eng_def: young people, both male and female, considered as a group

youthful.eng_def: having the qualities that are typical of young people
youthful.chi_def: 年輕人特有的；富有青春活力的；朝氣蓬勃的
youthful.eg: At the time I admired his youthful enthusiasm.
A youthful president can be good for a country's morale.

yucky.chi_def: 令人厭惡的，讓人反感的

yummy.eg: I think I'll have some more of that yummy chocolate cake.
And tell her to bring along that yummy brother of hers.

zebra.eng_def: an African wild animal that looks like a horse, with black or brown and white lines on its body

zero.eg: Five, four, three, two, one, zero.

zero.eng_def: on a set of numbers for comparing temperature in degrees Celsius, the level of temperature at which water freezes
zero.eg: The temperature is expected to drop to ten degrees below zero tonight.

zinc.eng_def: a chemical element that is a bluish-white metal, used in making other metals or for covering other metals to protect them

zip.eng_def: a device consisting of two rows of metal or plastic teeth-like parts that are brought together by pulling a small sliding piece over them, used for closing openings in clothing, bags, etc.

zip.eg: The new engine has given the car a lot more zip.

zip.eng_def: to fasten something with a zip
zip.eg: This bag's too full, I can't zip it shut.

zip.eng_def: to move or go somewhere very quickly
zip.eg: I'm just going to zip over to the shops - I won't be long.

zip.eng_def: to compress (= reduce the size of) a computer file so that it uses less space, and can be more easily sent or stored
zip.eg: Zip the files before you email them.

zipper.eng_def: a device consisting of two rows of metal or plastic teeth-like parts that are brought together by pulling a small sliding piece over them, used for closing openings in clothing, bags, etc.

zone.eng_def: an area, especially one that is different from the areas around it because it has different characteristics or is used for different purposes
zone.chi_def: （尤指有不同特徵或用途的）地帶，地區

zone.eng_def: one of the five parts the earth is divided into according to temperature, marked by imaginary lines going around it from east to west
to give a special purpose to a particular area, such as an area in a town
zone.chi_def: 將…劃作特殊區域；指定…為某項用途的區域
zone.eg: The former dockyard has been zoned for industrial use.

zoo.eng_def: an area in which animals, especially wild animals, are kept so that people can go and look at them or study them
a place where there are a lot of people and their behaviour is not well organized or controlled
zoo.eg: The school cafeteria is a zoo.

zoom.eg: They got into the car and zoomed off.

zoom.eng_def: If prices or sales zoom, they increase suddenly and quickly.
zoom.eg: House prices suddenly zoomed up last year.

zoom.chi_def: 可變焦距鏡頭（同 zoom lens）
